description:
We stopped in here before for a snack (quesadilla), and watched the miracle of the Cubana sandwich in action. We weren't very hungry then, and had dinner reservations later, but made a mental note. 

Recently they made the top 15 sandwiches in the US and we had to go. Delicious!! We got the chicken one, and the chicken texture was kind of rough compared to the rest of the sandwich, but it had a good taste. I would try the beef one next time. They do have a Cubana that has both beef and chicken. It is a very large sandwich so we split one and we were both full. The salsa on top makes it perfect. It's so fun to just watch the lady make the food. She's really amazing. An artist. 

Note this is a total hole in the wall so if you're not into that, it's not your thing. It's right off the 24th street Bart station so very convenient.
author: Young B.

description:
This is a little liquor store and grill.  It falls under the "Dive" category in a good way.  This is not kitschy dive it is a old school one. 


There are a number of items on the wall mounted menu. However, it is The Cuban Sandwich at this place is legendary. So much so, that it was visited by Anthony Bordain on parts unknown. Caution hipsters, this is not a classic griddles Cuban sandwich.  It is there own invention. Grilled beef or chicken, an omelette, some ham on a custom deli bun.  It is giant.  One sandwich is big enough for three people. It is a perfect late night bender meal, or for the resulting hang over brunch. 

You can sit there and eat it. Or, like Anthony, in the adjoining bar.  Nice friendly folks.
author: Phil N.

description: I first learned about That's It from Anthony Bourdain.  Gourmet, NO.  Delicious, YES.  Huge huge huge but you will wait a while for it to be prepared.  Everyone in our family looks forward to getting this.  I have no clue what is in it.  I just know it is great (but not hot peppers for me).  One sandwich feeds my husband and me for two days (dinner).  Even my always hungry grandson and son cannot finish it no matter how determined they are.  And they have redone the cooking area.  Not many seats so be prepared to take out.
author: Vickie B.

description:
I came here because Anthony Bourdain came here once upon a time.  I had only been to SF once when I saw it and hadn't ventured to The Mission yet.  It seemed different from the parts of The City I had visited during my one week.  I recall seeing Bourdain trek here with a local, grab a  massive Torta (Mexican Sandwich) and I believe brown bag a beer from the store.  The sandwich looked great, it seemed to have a good vibe.  Somehow, about eight years after seeing that I finally made it.

That's It is known for their Cubana Sandwich (not to be confused with a Cubano or Cuban Sandwich) - which they bill to be the Biggest Cubana Sandwich in the World.  My instinct would be that this is at least possibly correct, because this is one serious Sandwich.  For $11, I'd be hard pressed to find a Sandwich this filling.  I could have happily stopped at half and not had another bite.  (I did crust the whole thing, and I'm writing this the next morning and still feeling it - in a good way...  Hit the gym hard today.)

The Cubana:  Eggs, Ham, Hot Dogs, Avocado, Jalapenos, Sour Cream, Queso Freso, Mayo, Lettuce, Tomato and your choice of Beef or Chicken Milanesa.  The Milanesa is fresh made, and if you're not familiar it is thinly slices meat that is breaded and grilled.  You can also add beans.  I listed a lot of things.  The only thing they skimp on is the lettuce.  Otherwise, you are eating LOTS of Protein.  The Cubana is so large that they cut the middle inch and a half of the roll out entirely so that their is more room for what's between the bread.  ...Wow.  If you eat the whole thing, will you leave hungry?  No.  No you will not.

I liked the vibe of the whole place.  They have just a few tables and three seats at the counter.  I believe another two by the door.  They have a pretty good selection of beer, wine and liquor.  I remember seeing Bourdain drink a beer, but I don't recall if this was in the joint, or if so if it was officially sanctioned.

I won't rush back to have this because it is like a Buffet in a Sandwich.  An All Inclusive Resort between Crust.  You'd do it all the time if there were no consequences.  But, Baby, there be consequences in life.
author: Adam S.

description: Small store but alot of choices of beverages . All the food looks good smells good . I'm waiting to say tastes good 2 .
author: Jade P.

description: Best torta ever! I can see why Bourdain loves this place. I ordered the torta cubana which has breaded fried beef or chicken milanesa(i went beef), ham, spicy pork chorizo, eggs, bacon, hot dogs, tomatos, lettuce, white cheese, sour cream, jalapeno peppers, and avocado. Its not only delicious but straight up massive. I eat alot and had a big lunch and dinner off it. They grilled it up fresh in front of you at a little bar and throw everything but the kitchen sink on this bad boy. Its a tiny hole in the wall bodega but great prices and chill friendly service. Highly recomended.
author: Sean G.

description: That's it - Is Amazing! The Cubana sandwich is big enough to share with one other person.  They have bar seating and two small tables so you can enjoy your food/drink inside.
author: Michelle F.

description: So good. I was hungover on the brink of death last Monday morning and went here to get the Cubana torta and it saved my life. So big and good. Loved all the meat in it and the egg just made it that much better. Great little place to sit down and eat. Best torta ever!!
author: Alec B.

description: Had to check it out for the hype of the biggest cubano, let's just say it's was worth the 2 hour drive!
author: Kirk P.

description: I got the cuban sandwich here.  It is quite large.   It wasn't exactly what i expected (did not include pulled pork, did include hot dog, chorizo) but it was quite good.
author: Michael E.

description:
THIS PLACE HAS BOMB AF sandwiches.
The lady and her niece make sandwiches from about 2 until closing. They are less than 10 bucks. We got a cubana, which has....wait for it.... Ham. Hot dog sausage. pork. beef. bacon. she added fried egg because duh.
The bread was slightly toasted. OMG, it was amazing.
They have little stools to sit, sauces to add to the sandwich. We literally woke up salivating for another. 
The middle eastern owner also makes fresh hummus and falafels. I would def go back. everyone in there is super cool from the cashier to the people hanging out. LOVE, it takes me back to living in the mission.
author: francis c.

description: Was recently scammed by Postmates due to my driver going to this convenience store instead of the one I selected.  Since my driver opted to go to this store, I was gauged on the cost of the items my friends selected (two packs of beer and two packs of cigarettes).  For the record, I do not smoke. Take a look at the receipt that I'm posting as a photo here, a whopping $10.75 plus tax per pack!  I would never waste my money on gross cigarettes, but this store is taking advantage of people by charging $10.75 plus tax per pack.  The beer was grossly overpriced as well - $23 per 12 pack.  Never using Postmates again and certainly never going to this store.
author: Emma H.

description: Great torta.  The two gentlemen manning the register and stocking the market's shelves had a welcoming rapport and the woman on the grill warmly made recommendations.   Beef amongst the Cubana's meat was definitely a good call.  The bread was fresh, light and flakey and the sandwich had the right balance of everything.  Perfect.
author: Jason R.

description: The cubano is out of this world!!  This sando can feed several people, no joke!   Perfect 1am fix for those that want anything other than fastfood.
author: Patrick C.

description: Finally I get to come n try the infamous CUBANA !!! So so much meat in this huge sandwich.. wow.. messy !! But worth every bite.. limited items on their menu.. i want to try it all in the menu..-but jus 5 items lol... yay will come again... full liquor store !!!!
author: Crisy G.

description: This is probably my favorite place to eat chicken quesadillas  fast,cheap and always good btw the ladies are really nice!!!
author: Myra M.

description: WOW this needs a huge shout out. It's a little store with a huge amount of flavor. The cubana is unbelievable!  I literally took 5-6 bites of mine and couldn't eat anymore. That's like a 1/4 of the half, if even. So delicious and so huge!  The young gentleman working the register was so nice, friendly and welcoming to everyone that came in (Steve i think?). The lady cooking was just the same (didn't get her name). She smiled the whole time.
author: Eleena R.

description:
The torta cubano is humungo and loaded with goodness. What's in it, you ask. (Or I ask, for the sake of this yelp review). 14+ ingredients stuffed between bread. Check it- beef or chicken milanesa, ham, chorizo, eggs, bacon, hot dogs, tomatoes, lettuce, cheese, sour cream, mayo, jalapenos, avocado, and beans.

The lady makes it fresh when you order, so you see all the tender loving fat that goes in here. Fresh off the press... meaning hot grill. For $11, treat yo-self. 

This place is a corner market that serves a few hot items to go. In addition to tortas, they'll make quesadillas, tamales, tacos, falafels, wraps, etc. Prices are around $10 or less. Two blocks from the 24th street Mission bart station.
author: Joanna L.

description: Tried the famous cubano and enjoyed it with a decently priced beer at Dolores park. Next time Ill get something with there freshly pressed tortillas
author: Danielle S.

description: Absolute scumbags. They liked about their offering then tried to charge double for food I didn't ask for. Stay far far away from there people, much better food options from year SF residents close by.
author: Jay B.

description: I wish I could've given this place a chance, but it was totally unsanitary. The woman cooking was  cross contaminating the food, touching the uncooked beef and the bread with her bare hands. She also flipped the tortilla with her hands without washing them. She was also very uninviting. She barely made eye contact when taking our order, and had no sense of urgency while a line of people were waiting to also order. I don't think this place is worth risking stomach ache.
author: Nina N.

description: Really disappointed. Went for their signature sandwich because I saw lots of good things said about it here and ended up with sandwiches with really dry and burned meats. Not even friendly staff there (one of them was high as a kite). Not coming back.
author: Samantha L.

description: The veggie quesadilla was fantastic. The woman making them started with a ball of dough and actually pressed and made a fresh tortilla on the spot. It's definitely what I would call more authentic (and delicious) than the usual TexMex you find in the United States, and the prices are quite reasonable for the generous amount of food they give you.
author: Craig D.

description:
So I was able to try out this place because my friend accidentally left his torta at my apartment after a long night out...so it was obviously scarfed down by me immediately. Poor guy.

Maybe I'm a bit biased because it was "free" in my case, but OMG this was the best torta I've ever had. Not that I've eaten many tortas in my life to be completely fair but it was PACKED with toppings. And my friend is vegetarian so there wasn't even any meat in it! I swear there was like an entire avocado or something though. I also like my tortas super saucy and this was a saucy torta indeed. Pickled veggies were nicely pickled and a good bunch of jalapeños in there too cause ya girl likes her food spicy okay. 

I will definitely come back here to try the cubana torta next time. Come here to grab a six pack and leave with a torta. That's the way to go I'm telling ya!
author: Ellen M.

description:
This was arguable the most disgusting quesadilla I've ever had.  I don't know if something was lost in translation (the cook had to bring the cashier over to take our order), but it was a tortilla filled with lettuce...and no cheese.  In fairness, the tortilla was fresh and hand rolled, but that could not make up for it.

The other people I was with ordered the Cubano.  The sandwich is enormous (two people could share one, easily), and my friends were picking out the copious amounts of hot dog stuffed inside.

Unless you're looking for a case of beer in the area, I don't understand the high reviews for this place.
author: Kelly E.

description:
This store is awesome, the owners do a great job in utilizing what little space they have available to combine a traditional corner market with a delicious sandwich counter. The market portion of this establishment is decent, they offer all the standard convenience store staples like chips, candy, soda, and beer, but the real gem is and forever will be; the made to order sandwich counter. 
  I'm sure that everything they prepare is delicious, but I only ever come here for their Cubano sandwiches, they truly are the star of the show and are guaranteed to have your taste buds spinning in a flurry of flavors. 
  First off, they are huge, I am convinced that some sort of sorcery or black magic is responsible for the creation of this sandwich, as they manage to pack each Torta roll with a ridiculous amount of ingredients, so many in fact that two hands just aren't enough to contain this beast. They start by stacking each sandwich with every kind of meat imaginable from bacon to Chorizo and just as the height starts to peak, they top it all off with egg and fresh melted cheese.
  Secondly, they always have fair prices, each sandwich is around $11 or so, but is more than enough food for 2 people to share or for 1 person to stretch into 2-3 meals. 
  Lastly, the chef is very friendly, she always puts all of her heart into her food, which shows through her use of fresh ingredients and the look of satisfaction she gives off as she feeds the masses.
author: Joseph A.

description: This is honestly the first review I've ever written and this place totally knocked my socks off for me not to. The cubana is easily one of the best sandwiches I've ever had. I didn't catch his name but the cashier was super nice too. I live in San Jose but I'm definitely coming back!
author: Roya A.

description: Yes 'that's it'. Literally all I can eat ever again. This intercontinental ballistic flavour missile will propel you into a ham coma that you won't wake from until next winter. Don't let its liquor store motif detour you from this epic toppings mosaic of a sandwich that defies the laws of flavour.
author: Steve T.

description: The cubana is enormous. I recommend sharing it with someone. Very satisfying. Greasy and goood
author: Dave C.

description: guy at front register is a sexist. he had the nerve to speak about a woman in the streets that was clearly in bad mental state saying "well if she's dressed that way she deserves it" mind you this young woman had a dress and heels. goes to show what kind of dirty disrespectful men work in that environment. will never go or recommend to anyone.
author: Nathaly T.

description:
I'm back for more punishment,  but we'll worth it.
The cuban, the Cuban with extra jalapeño. 
The Cuban with beers oh man...
Eating here is making my clothes tight....
author: Matt J.

description: Full times I've eaten the giant sandwich here I have forgotten to review it just because it was so damn good I was too busy. It's definitely an experience to get this Beast of a sandwich that has egg bacon hot dog sour cream avocado cheese I recommend getting the chicken over the beef.
author: Jeremy R.

description:
My friend mentioned that this place sells Cuban sandwiches, and that Anthony Bourdain has been here. We stopped in during lunch hours, and the place was packed.  The seating is limited, so snag a chair/stool if it's available.  The decor is simple, its a liquor store with a bench area for the food preparation. 

We ordered the Cuban sandwich, the wait was 15 minutes.  I liked the vibe, and the sandwich is huge for the price. It includes milanesa (breaded carne asada), chorizo, egg, and hot dog with jalapeños, lettuce etc.

Overall, I give the sandwich a 3.5 (tasted better as leftovers, flavors came out).  I'll come back again, and you should if you're ever close to 24/Mission
author: Marlon T.

description:
I'm going to keep it real: I don't know jack about Anthony Bourdain nor do I care about his recommendation. 

I strolled into this place because my boyfriend and I were hungry, were out and about looking for a spot to get our late night grub on, walked past this store, got a whiff of something awesome, scoped the little Latina lady chef'ing it up at the grill, looked at each other and thought, "Eff it. Let's do it."

I'm from the East Coast so sketchy corner stores (or bodegas as we like to call them) serving up something proper and delicious is no surprise to me. This place is a liquor store/bodega/cafeteria type spot. Essentially, you're dining in at a Liquor Store, so ambiance is severely lacking. Your food even comes with a pack of Newports on the side.

I kid, of course. 

Environment aside, this place is bomb.com. Yes, I used that incredibly cheesy phrase. It's justified.

These tortas are INSANE. I had the Milanesa which was deliciosooooo. My boyfriend ordered the famous "Cubana" which we had no idea was so famous until after the fact. Gargantuan in size containing every meat you could possibly think of. Meat Lovers, you will be so happy you ordered this bad boy.

Authentic. Tasty. Perfect. So glad we found this little spot and I will, without a doubt, return next time I visit the Bay area.
author: Michelle S.

description:
My friend had told me about the tortas at That's It Market a few years ago, but I never thought much about it, or to inquire about going myself. But since we were out together that day, we decided to head over to pickup lunch.

I didn't realize how large the tortas were until my friend, who has a hearty appetite, mentioned that the last time he went, he could only finish half of one himself. So I was thinking to myself...wow...I'll definitely have leftovers. But it ended up working out -- we decided to share one between the two of us.

So we walked in around 12:30, placed our order for the Cuban torta, waited about 15 minutes, and $10 later, our lunch was ready. (Fortunately, there was no line when we got there...a few others walked in just after us, and their orders + mine filled up the griddle ) The Cuban/Cubana consists of: breaded beef, pork sausage, chicken, pork leg, ham, bacon and eggs. No wonder it's so filling!

If you're ever in the area or looking to try something different, I would recommend checking out That's It. For $10, you will be satisfied!

There's plenty of parking around, but if you want to avoid paying $5.75/hour on Mission, look for a side street. We found non-metered street parking a couple of blocks away, without any problems.
author: Audrey C.

description:
Torta Cubana, Torta Cubana.. everyone raves how good it is. YES it is the second best torta I've had (my fave is Super Tortas Chilangas in Sac) in my entire life.

To me.. I absolutely love this place because I always buy a scratcher AND IT HITS (i.e. I win money) to subsidize or cover my sandwich. It's probably a fluke but it's happened the last 3/4 trips. 

Drunchies + free Torta Cubana = perfect way to end a night.
author: Chris W.

description: Visiting here from LA. and somebody suggested this place. We ordered a Cubana sandwich and a regular torta. Super good- glad we stopped. Totally worth the search for a parking spot!!
author: Heather Z.

description:
The world's largest torta cubana is a very large sandwich.  I have eaten it twice - once while drunk, once while sober.  while drunk, the world's largest torta cubana is a revelation, an epiphany, the culinary equivalent of the heavens parting and a chorus of angels singing.  While sober, it's a pretty good, albeit ridiculous, sandwich.

If you're not a habitual glutton like I am, you could probably share with a friend and both be uncomfortably full.
author: Kyle W.

description: Review is for my sandwich-the Cubana. Enormous. I have a bottomless pit type of appetite, and after a CrossFit workout of extreme intensity ('Murph', if you know what it means) I was STILL struggling to eat the whole thing. The hot dog I can do without next time. This is not organic, grass fed meat. Just keeping it real. That's why it's big and cheap. We're talking steak um' type beef here. I'm pretty sure it was unpleasant to watch me eat at the counter (it's a messy/drippy ish sandwich) so I left her a tip. Which I felt was necessary regardless. Maybe I should have left more?
author: Richard V.

description: The sleazy Spanish speaking cashier  deliberately tried to charge me twice for a case of beer. 30$ and then only gave me the receipt for 20$. I only saw the 30$ charge on my statement. Go to hell.
author: Justin C.

description:
Um that cubano sandwich...DAYUM. 

Me and my friends are big eaters, and we met our match. The sheer size of their sandwiches is awesome. When you figure out the calories you get per dollar, unbeatable in SF. 

A sanctuary for hungry carnivores.
author: Ryan S.

description:
Absolutely terrible service. Forgot order numerous times and made mistakes. Visibly dirty and no hygiene when preparing food. Saw them cleaning the floors and then going straight to the grill without washing hands. 

Possibly a 50% chance of getting food poisoning from here. But hey, if you don't get sick- the sandwich isn't half bad.
author: Niloy M.

description:
You would think anything that had Anthony Bourdain's stamp of approval would be easily 4 or more stars but sadly I did not feel that way. In case you were wondering, That's It Market is known for having the largest Torta sandwich. 

It's essentially an overload of proteins bathed in margarine/butter sandwiched between two giant slices of bread. If you are on a diet, this is not for you but if you need a midnight hangover cure/munchies fix then this Torta Sandwich is definitely meant for you.

Overall Thoughts

While the portion and price is certainly worth wild, the flavors were underwhelming and too heavy for my palate and stomach
author: Eddie W.

description:
This place is authentic!  Don't judge it by the sign out front, nor the fact that it's tucked away in a corner of a grocery store. 

The Tortas Cubanas sandwich is the BEST Cuban sandwich experience you'll have in the mission. It's seriously mind blowing how delicious one sandwich can be, & for $10 (it's the size of a football so split it with Ya' friend) you can't beat it anywhere. 

Look for the green sign out front, it's on the corner. 

Note, the sun fat seafood co. Is a block away, and they have HELLA oysters and fresh seafood ALL DAY. Try it out too!
author: David L.

description:
Late Night Munchies were absolutely needed for hungry girls during a night of extended happy hours and good times while hanging at the Mission bar in SF. 

I was on a mission in the Mission to bring back the best and that's when I thought "What would Anthony Bourdain do?" He would probably sling back a couple shots before ordering up a Cubano and a Torta from That's It Market.

I ordered one Steak Torta and one Cubano, both approximately 4.5"W x 8"L x3"H -which I had cut in thirds. Even a 1/3 was enough for each of us, so we devoured the torta at the bar and took the rest to go.

In our drunken haze we took the Cubano home and split it again 3 ways for breakfast. That's when we discovered it had: Steak, Chicken,  Bacon, Hot Dogs, Eggs, Ham, peppers, tomatoes, avocado, sauces, condiments and who knows what else. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/OVx1jiJRVoZg3jDkPvehQg?select=u1h0oB7gnVYWOFQIqehTLg

As we sat there eating the reheated version of the every meat cubano, we wondered how much better would it have been the first day. Either way it was really good and I got to check out another one of Bourdain's stops in my city.
author: Rebekah T.

description:
Mahalo to Bay Area Yelper Rebekah T.! 

After doing a dine and dash at Farolito, I remembered Rebekah's review, and That's It Market was very close by. We got to the street corner  and stepped inside. There, we met Maddie(sp???) One of the sweetest ladies you'll ever come across.

She directs us to sit up at the little counter and takes time out to answer any questions we have. We were on a mission to tackle the famous Torta Cubana,
but I also came across the quesadilla section and saw that she had Huitlacoche, a very prized corn fungus. If you never had it, I'd describe the taste as kinda earthy,  similar to mushroom with a slight sweetness from the bits of corn. I had to get that as well.

It was cool to see Maddie work her magic in a griddle top no larger than 2 feet by 3 feet. First up was the Huitlacoche Quesadilla. A fresh tortilla loaded with huitlacoche, lettuce, queso fresco and salsa verde on the side...ABSOLUTELY FRICKIN' FANTABULOUS! Awesome flavors and a great start.

Now on to the torta....toasted bread, steak, ham, hot dog, chorizo and eggs, lettuce,
tomato, mayo, sour cream, and avocado, this thing is a MONSTER and so worth it at $10 a pop.
She makes about 60+ of these bad boys a day, and I can totally see why Anthony Bourdain was lovin' this sandwich...all your basic food groups in a torta? What's not to love???

You have to get your head and mouth at just the right angle to get your first bite of nirvana in....one of the best sandwiches ever created!  We only got through half and ate the rest the next day. We thanked Maddie, headed out the door and was on to our last mission in the Mission, dessert....ALOHA!!!

YELP 365 CHALLENGE-(241/365) " Tackling The $10 Torta"
author: Nelson Q.

description:
The joint itself looks sketchy as hell. A little corner liquor store with an apartment-style kitchen on the sidewall. But if you take a peek inside, all that need be said about this place is that the torta cubana deserves a review all it's own. A mountain of meat, egg, and mayonnaise sandwiched in between two pillow-soft bun rolls; this thing is unlike anything I've ever digested. I literally had to stand up to get the whole thing in a picture. 

If you're looking for a fancy, sit down Mexican restaurant, this is definitely, definitely not the spot for you. However, if you're looking for a late night, "I feel like making a bad decision and eating until my face hurts" kinda place, then this is the joint for you. One of my favorite late-night San Francisco spots.

Come hungry.. leave in pain. What more could you ask for..?
author: Jeff S.

description:
These tortas were huge and bomb!!  My boyfriend got the cubana, which in my opinion has way too many things in it, so I just got the chicken milanesa which is still stacked with a million things, but perfect.  We split that one 3 ways, and it felt like plenty.  

However as for beer, prices are pretty steep.  It is a small market though, so I guess that's to be expected.  And, they didn't win us the lottery.  So there's that.  BUT go here for tortas!!
author: Sonia S.

description: This place has the most amazing Cuban Tortas. I'm from Sacramento California and every time I go to San Francisco to watch the Giants play I always make sure I go to That's It Market. The place is a hole in the wall inside of a liquor store but the food is worth it. I have been to the restaurant probably about 20 times and the standard is always excellent. Every time I go the food is always as good or better than the time before. I also get the same thing every time. I recommend everyone try the Cubano with everything on it. The sandwich is around a couple lbs in weight and if you are not a big eater I recommend splitting one with a friend. The food is Amazing and the cooks are very nice people. So next time you are in San Francisco go visit and eat at That's it Market on Mission. *Update* still love this place!
author: Thomas R.

description:
Good tortas good food ..i tried the cubans it was really good.mixture of great flavor.....GOT A HANGOVER..eat a torta cubana. Good service..OH YEA! IT'S A LIQUOR STORE:-) BUT can't drink beer in the place :-( 
So i had a coke.and a beer afterwards.. no good deals on beer tho....i'm definitely coming back.. i came here with my girlfriend and her daughter. Her daughter had a chorizo torta.it was also good
author: Nacho G.

description:
This place has been home for many great times.  The owners and workers are very nice and friendly.  

Go to Mission Bar next door, drink some well vodka shots, and play pool until the pool sharks come along. When you're broke and can't make it to Columbus and Broadway, take 2 more well shots of vodka and go to the minivan in front of Bank of America on 23rd and Mission.  There's a guy selling hot dogs, get two with everything on it and chew on one of the raw peppers.  

Come back to That's It Market and order the Torta Cubano.  By this time you're now on auto-pilot.  You're no longer making your own decisions and you're not capable thinking critically and that's ok because it takes about 10 minutes for these to be ready and it will feel like time travel.  

When you get the torta cubano, pour a ton of hot sauce into the Torta and eat it as fast as you can.  If you come here often and build a relationship with the owners they might treat you to some dessert on a holiday.  Don't head to the back because there are gruesome mutilation magazines that might make you feel uneasy and it might kill your buzz and you don't want that if you want to finish strong.

This place also has great gifts for Christmas, child births, birthdays, and weddings behind the cashier.  I personally go with the bottle of Jack Daniels with two shot glasses.
author: John A.

description: Been coming here for 4 years on thanksgiving not for thanksgiving but because I don't celebrate and they are open! It's a corner store but there's a little Cuban lady whipping up some good comida. Minus a star cause the owner can be a bit moody but I don't blame him there are a lot of riff raff walking through the door.
author: Roxanne O.

description:
Yes, yes, I know writing about the Torta Cubana is redundant, but that's no reason not to give it it's due. Fact is, I was sitting on the couch tonight, someone on FB posted a pic of a supposedly awesome sandwich, and I immediately thought back to my visit to this market 3 years ago and specifically to this sandwich.  Anything that leaves that much of an impression must either suck balls or be completely awesome.  This was the latter. 

I do give credence to Mr. Bourdain's opinions on food,  so when he said go, I went the next chance I got.  And it was awesome.  Everyone knows what's on the Cubana from other reviews. Is it a lot? Yes. Is it overkill? Yes. But it is glorious overkill.  The meats,  breaded and fried. The creamy guac. The tang from the mayo. Tomato and lettuce and jalapeños to cut the meatiness. And the egg. Egg never didn't make something better.  I was done halfway through, but I could not put the damn thing down.  I finished it, and I have never been more happy to feel like crap.  And out of sheer guilt, I walked all the way back to Embarcadero, all the while in a stuporous food coma. Next time I'm in San Fran, first thing I'm doing is getting a Cubana, but this time I'm sharing.
author: Michael P.

description:
I kind of have a crush on Anthony Bourdain. Who doesn't? His checkered past, his epicurean way of life, his sardonic wit, what's not to love? The man loves meat, alcohol and a good conversation. He gets me. If he gives something his thumbs up, then I'm certainly willing to try it. 

That's It Market is a small corner convenience store on Mission St. It's easy to miss if you don't know what you're looking for. But of course, people on an Anthony Bourdain pilgrimage like me will find it pretty quickly. 

The Torta Cubana lives up to its legendary reputation. First of all, it's massive. Hefty portions of breaded beef, sausage, chicken, pork leg, ham, and bacon hit the grill. I looked around to check if she had more than one sandwich order pending, but nope. All that sizzling goodness was for one sandwich. Aaand she wasn't finished. In went some mayonnaise, lettuce, tomato, egg, jalapeño and I don't even know what else. She could've thrown in an entire garden in there, and the meat would have still been way more. 

This sandwich was so big, I could barely hold half of it in my hand. Hot, meaty, messy, it's all good. With the filling in imminent danger of falling out, I ate as quickly as I could. I polished off my half of the torta before my stomach could send the white flag signal to my brain. Realization set in. Must. Unbutton. Pants. 

Any meat gluttony remorse? No, sir. Bourdain did not disappoint. This, the largest torta cubana in existence, was worth (half-) conquering. It had to be done.
author: Racquel N.

description:
Sometimes bigger is better.  Like Nicki Minaj's booty, IMAX theater screens,  and my paycheck when I work overtime.   But sometimes bigger isn't better.  Like Kristy Alley,  JaMarcus Russell, and unfortunately the Cubana.  

Don't get me wrong, it's big.  All the kush in the world couldn't help me finish it.  Taste wise it's average though.  I used to deliver Frito-Lay here and all of the mission, and a simple Pollo Milanesa is all I need or want.  The Cubana is over the top.  If over the top is what you want, "THAT's IT".  But I've had better flavored tortas.  

But it's pointless to eat a whole lot.  I'm not the host of man vs. food.  Eating this sandwich left me feeling a little guilty.  And a worthless, farting, sleepy mess.
author: Michael L.

description:
I just went to this place to try Torta Cubana and i did't   disappoint,it was so delicious.i will come back again for sure to try other stuff aswell.the other thing that i like about this place is it  
is open till 2am which is rare in San Francisco.
author: Mohammad M.

description: I will admit right off the bat I tried this place with my boyfriend and his sister only because Anthony Bourdain tried it :) and I ordered the exact item he did! The Torta Cuban is for anyone with a very big appetite. It has everything you can think of in it from Avocado to Hot dogs cheese, mayo, peppers, ham etc....I know I know you must be thinking how can one person consume such a huge sandwich?! I did not --I shared. This was one of the most delicious sandwiches I have ever eaten. The location is not the best, but it is such a bang for your buck and can feed 3 people easy. I highly suggest this little hole in the wall market to anyone looking for something to overindulge in :) What I loved most about this place was the women making my food--she reminded me of some of my own family members and cooked everything up with lots of love!
author: Stephanie F.

description:
I had the Torta Cubana at That's It Market bookmarked but really forgot why until I showed up and saw the sign for Anthony Bourdain's No Reservations. OMG. What had I gotten myself into? Luckily I already had a sandwich sampling plan in place so we split the sandwich.

Torta Cubana = ham, breaded beef, hot dogs, chorizo, eggs, cheese, avocado, jalapenos, lettuce, tomato, and mayo sandwiched between two lofty slices of a soft roll

The sandwich is just like it's described but it's a little astounding to watch it getting made. They kept throwing things on the grill and I wondered really is all that for my sandwich or is she making two? It's not a sandwich for everyday but good on a weekend or after a long night of drinking (I'm just theorizing now). All that meat really hits the spot. And though it sounds and looks like too much it's really very good. All the flavors come together really well. 

It's the size of two normal sandwiches so I highly recommend you split it. Even after splitting it I was very full. It's not like you split it to be on a diet. It's like you split it so you can physically eat it.

I'm not sure if it's the best torta in the mission but it is good. Extra star for being such a typical Mission place - sandwiches in a corner of a liquor store, and not a hipster one like Rhea's either.
author: Jean K.

description:
Bourdain's blood is all over this one... my sole impetus to hunt this place down. A super cool new friend and I came here to 'experiment' and hopefully repeat Bourdain's bodacious adventure ($10) with the Cubana torta.

I expected the worst and held on for dear life as I awaited bonding time with my friend "john". Luckily, it never came, and most befuddled was I. That thing was not a sandwich...it was more a conglomeration of cheap, non-quality ingredients (cheap hot dogs..omg) of every sort smashed together with Pak-N-Save like bleached ICK-O 'french' bread. Phew... big it is indeedy. I just braced myself and got thru most of my half, especially since 6 or so mi. of hiking in the sun will bring on the munchies!

Good thing we split the sandwich, cuz I just didn't know what to do. at all. If you're looking for a gastroinstestinal knot twisting of inferior quality ingredients pushed into sub-par bread (even truco torta bread are more authentic), go for the gold and take your chances. Just have Pepto and some Maalox by the bedstand.
author: Jana C.

description: Went here a couple years ago because my dad and uncle saw it on anthony bordains show. Me and my dad could barely finish half of the torta cubana. My uncle madd the uneducated decision of ordering a whole one for himself and not just half. The only healthy thing in thatbsandwich was avocado, but it was the best torta ive eaten
author: Adrian R.

description:
I walked past That It Market at 2am one random weekend and had a half-drunken half-daft homeless man yell at me about how great their Cuban sandwich is.

"Yeah, OK, crazy man," I mumbled to myself and hurriedly walked past.

After simmering on this seemingly nutty recommendation, (yeah, I listen to the crazies, so what?) I came back a few weeks later to sample the torta Cubana.

I went in for lunch on Wednesday, sat at "the bar," and ordered up a sammich to share. Each time a slab of meat was thrown on the grill, a healthy tablespoon (or two) of melted butter was added to it.

"Con todo?" she asked as she spackled-on mayo with a spatula and squirted avocado from a squeezie bottle.

"Yes, everything, please." I responded. She wasn't kidding, seriously, this sandwich has everything but the kitchen sink: breaded beef, pork sausage (looked like meat poop when she squeezed it out of the plastic casing), chicken, pork leg, ham, bacon, mayonnaise, tomato, lettuce, avocado, cheese, and (I swear, ours had) scrambled eggs.

Dude, that crazy drunk was spot on: it was duuuuh-licious. Even with all that butter added to it, it wasn't greasy at all. We each finished our respective halves and were full for the rest of the day. And for $10 ($5 per person), it's a steal!
author: Adena B.

description: I went to buy some water. I bought a 1.25L bottle of sparkling water for 2.75, which is fairly expensive but not outrageous. The bottle had a broken safety seal though which was really sketch--either someone had already opened it and taken a swig or they had taken an old bottle and refilled it with carbonated water from some other source. It tasted OK though.
author: Kerrick S.

description:
didn't know Bourdain's been here. that explains the large food section and pricey everything else. no one dining here noonish. didn't see a menu so didn't take a chance

drink: millers beer (40 oz. 2.5)
-only item worthwhile all, all drinks (soda, beer) pricey

drips:
-wire transfer machine (or something like that) popular here.
author: Victor G.

description:
I'm so ashamed... 
I promised myself I wouldn't.... 
I said I would never order it...NEVER!... 
Weak...I am a WEAK man! 

Like anyone else who watches Anthony Bourdain's "No Reservations", I am filled with a certain level of envy as he is able to explore the culinary delights to be found around the world, no matter how fundamentally unhealthy they may be. His San Francisco adventure was no exception. Yes, I've been to the House of Prime Rib and Red's Java House. However, I was intrigued by the gigantic torta he devoured at this place. But I said to myself I would never eat it... NEVER! 

On Friday evening, I was stag since Jamie W. was out of town on a work trip. I decided to stay on BART until 24th Street. Crazy, right? I can be so impetuous sometimes. Anyway, I was strolling along Mission thinking that maybe I should take a left and go to Herbivore. But lo and behold, in front of me was the market. At the crosswalk, I faced a life-altering dilemma... do I cross Mission and walk over to Herbivore, or do I cross 23rd and enter the dark unknown of That's It?

Well, the sign does say "WORLD'S LARGEST TORTAS CUBANA", and it wasn't dark or even crowded. In fact, it's a well-kept, well-lit mini-mart with a deli counter and grill on the right. I recognized the mini-counter from the show. Oh, and there's the same woman. Her name is Alicia, and she's a sweetheart. Not a single person was eating there at 6:30PM, so I just sat on a stool. Oh wait, I forgot to get my drink from the fridge. OK, I'm ready. I asked for a Chorizo (Pork Sausage) Torta Cubana and watched her assemble it like she's probably done a few thousand times before. 

Alicia takes a really large, soft roll and slathers one side with sour cream and mayonnaise and covers that with shredded lettuce and tomato slices. She asks me if I want jalapenos. I tell her to bring it on. The smashed avocados come next and then she starts smashing up the sausage and grilling that up. Then Alicia asks me if I want eggs in it. I tell her again to bring it on. Somehow she manages to put in cheese and refried beans in the blink of an eye. 

The two halves of the roll are lying back side down on the grill while the chorizo sizzles. Alicia miraculously scrunches all of it all together, wraps it in butcher paper and places it on a blue fiesta plate (see photo). I've never seen anything so voluminous in my life. I didn't know how to pick it up, so I started spearing it with a plastic fork. Alicia was watching my struggle and brought me a pile of napkins and a plastic knife. Of course, it was delicious with all the ingredients either oozing out or flopping onto the plate. 

I kept thinking I looked like Joan Collins in that episode of "Will & Grace" when Grace comes upon her in a fast food tacqueria with all the guacamole and sour cream all over her face. It was disgusting but strangely provocative at the same time. Perhaps I was provocative. No, I was a pig but at least a satisfied pig for $8.50 (and $2 less if you print out their Yelp page). With the can of Diet Coke, I got out of here for less than ten bucks. Oh c'mon, you know you want to try it, too. Admit it. You're as weak as I am. 

FOOD - 4 stars...oozing and overstuffed as it is, it is pretty tasty in a gluttonous kind of way 
AMBIANCE - 4 stars...a lot nicer than I expected and really great when you're the only one gorging on the torta 
SERVICE - 4 stars...Alicia rocks 
TOTAL - 4 stars...I am overcoming my shame
author: Ed U.

description: I love big tortas.  This place has big tortas.  It's not fancy, it's rustic, a little shop, but I love it!
author: Mike Z.

description:
TORTA CUBANA!!!!!!!!!!
TORTA CUBANA!!!!!!!!!!
LALALALALALALALA!!!!!!

My friend found this place recently from either Yelp or "No Reservations", and told me how great it was & that we have to go together.

A date was made & we were set to go on a Friday after work. Before going, I watched "No Reservations" and became really excited, SOOO EXCITED!!!!

So off on our date we go, parking was not very hard to find. Just remember to bring coins for meter parking.

2 Torta Cubanas PLEASE!!! Jalapeno and hot sauce on the side please. The lady makes it fresh for you http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/OVx1jiJRVoZg3jDkPvehQg?select=I3tkHL7VeHr-DR6jYMMJ6A

What's in a TORTA CUBANA???
Uhh...bread, avocado, hamburger patty?, hot dog, egg, bacon, ham deli meat...

Print out your coupon from YELP before going for $2 off a TORTA CUBANA!!! A TORTA CUBANA!!!!

First impression of a TORTA CUBANA! A TORTA CUBANA! It is GINORMOUS. 2 friends shared one and I ate half of another and saved the rest for later. 

4 stools with no place to sit, so we went to the bar next door.
author: Kylie L.

description:
Fans of "No Reservations" have to make the pilgrimage to That's It http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/OVx1jiJRVoZg3jDkPvehQg?select=NC7TnMj29QVnkuL-vzAODg to eat the same big ass Torta Cubano that Bourdain had. Period. 

This was on my to-try list for a while and I finally went with a friend one Saturday afternoon. We had debated if we should share or just order one each. Upon entering the store, my friend decided we could handle one each since "the bun doesn't look that big." Well that's because it hadn't been stuffed yet. 

And so we ordered 2 Torta Cubanos proudly and were given the Yelp discount of $2 off. We watched as the wonderful lady behind the counter started to prepare the meats by first melting a stick of butter. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/OVx1jiJRVoZg3jDkPvehQg?select=9GiSo3YkiyCVjYXO_tEleA Adding breaded steak, bacon, hot dogs, chorizo, and egg to the grill and we were beginning to see we were in for a caloric buffet. The final result - one big ass sammie. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/OVx1jiJRVoZg3jDkPvehQg?select=Eo-Tb_3vhqqQct2DFmLmOQ 

A walk to Delores park for sunshine and food helps to work up the appetite but alas it's just not enough to help you conquer the torta. It is just that big. See the cross-section here -  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/OVx1jiJRVoZg3jDkPvehQg?select=RMKAD3Bl7a9O1pMllbxHTg I ate half the sandwich and had a fantastic picnic under the sun. Not bad for a lazy afternoon with another snack in hand for later.

It's worth coming to That's It to try the Torta Cubano. It's probably something you're not going to order too often, but it's something to try so you can say you did.
author: Jon L.

description:
Ok, Anthony Bourdain. I don't always agree with you, but I will say this was a fine, fine choice. I get why you like it. It's like a hot mess. Except not so hot. More like a disgusting mess. Disgustingly... GOOD.

Listen to the reviews. one tortas cubanas is sickly filling - I'd really split it if I were you. No, really. Really.

If I can remember correctly, there was: guacamole, sour cream, lettuce, tomato, sausage patty, hot dogs, ham, fried egg scramble and jalapenos served on a fat slice of bread. I would normally knock them a star for using hot dogs in place of chorizo, but I was quite delighted by how massive and amazing it tasted anyway. With Yelp's $2 off coupon, $8 for a sandwich for 2? It's f*cking deliciously disgusting is what it is. Get yourself some napkins and a drink... and be prepared for a massive heart attack.
author: Joanne Y.

description: Oh-My-God... the Torta Cubana. Yum. That is all. Good day.
author: Supreet C.

description: cubano - tasty gut bomb. Big enough to share. $11 I prefer the quesadillas! You can order and sit at the corner. Part grill. Part liquor store! I could get used to this!
author: Lizzy O.

description:
Imma have to give this place a 3 1/2 stars

despite the size of the Cubana Torta the taste is almost but not quite there for me. Everything in the sandwich screamed take another bite would of faired better if the hot dog was removed or changed to different brand or different meat, dont get me wrong the size alone of the sandwich speaks for itself the sauces and meats all mesh well even the bread was butter toasted you can taste it when you bite down, only gripe i had was the hot dog, didn't need to be there haha

I can honestly say you can probably feed 6 grown women with this sandwich haha guy wise if you can't finish it on your own honestly you shouldnt even order it haha.

lets run down the ingridents on this sandwich that I tasted:

Butter toasted huge Bread ***** wow
eggs **** i dont know if it was overeasy of scrambled but wow it was lightly salted
chicken milanesa (chicken fried steak) ***** thin & beaten to hell full of flavor for this enoromous Torat
chorizo **** not a fan but it kicked up heat on this sandwich
hot dogs no stars for this ingrident tasted like one of the mixed meats chicken, pork and beef, have them remove this if you decide to order this torta
bacon ***** crisp bacon literally bite down crunch !!!
jalepenos **** some more heat added you can request to not have jalapenos
mayo / mustard/ tomatoes and i think also avacadoes **** 

I know I am probably missing like 3-4 more ingridents but sheesh that is alot to remember

I would definitely hit this place up again give there cubano torta a second chance but ask for the hot dogs to be removed haha

food *** 1/2 almost there huge freakin torta!!
service *****
ambiance they got small seating area where you order ur sandwiches and other things
price $ 10bucks folks for the cubano torta and if you print the page you get it for $8
author: Clarence A.

description: Saw this featured on Anthony Bourdain and have been here twice now when visiting from out of town. The torta cubana is worth the stop! First time I came I grabbed a beer to have with my torta (just as I saw on the show) however you can't actually drink inside the place :/ but that was no problem for me really. Anyways, as for the torta, it does take a while to construct but it's worth the wait and surprisingly you can actually taste everything even with all the ingredients that go in it. It's the best torta I've had and will definitely go back when visiting the city.
author: D B.

description:
With Lent coming up, I decided to celebrate Fat Tuesday early by having another Cubana Torta at That's It Market.  This time was more of a personal challenge to me since the first time I had it, I was only able to eat half.  Well I took at least 25 minutes, but I finished it!!!  MAN WON!!  The best part was that I didn't even feel sick after.  Totally enjoyed it to the last bite.

I was a little bummed out that I didn't see the Yelp offer until now.  Could've saved $2!  Oh well.  It was great!
author: Rodney H.

description: Spend your money here. Do not go to McDonalds or Burger King. The torta Cubana here will crush on all fast food around the Mission. The torta is so huge and tasty that it put me in hibernation for about a week.
author: Michael A.

description:
Apparently this place was featured on national television, so obviously any attempt to remain low profile is bye bye.

Yep, the secret has been out for a while but it took a while for me to discover this place. We did take out, which is pretty much par for the course. I took my giant torta sandwich back home with me. I had just finished a bike ride and was starving. Can you hear my stomach growling? 

It would take most normal people an entire weekend to finish thing off, but who says I'm normal?

This torta had everything imaginable (and not so imaginable) under the sun. It was gone in mere minutes.

It's good. It's awesome, it added many inches to my love handles.
author: V B.

description:
This is clogged artery central, but every once in a while the sandwiches hit the spot.

Perfect lazy Sunday: Throw in a Tarantino movie, kick off your sneakers, take a bite off your sandwich and enjoy the rest of the night. That's it.
author: Darth M.

description: Oh man. That giant Torta Cubana feeds two people. It's glorious. Everyone's said all there is to say about it, so I'll just say "EAT IT NOW".
author: Harley C.

description:
Oh the cubana. The cubana. You haunt me in my dreams and you sure did a number on my stomach. I had to go run a couple of miles after eating you. For $10, that thing can feed a family of 5. As I was watching them make it, the meat kept on coming and coming and my eyes kept on opening and opening. Mind you I didn't watch the Anthony Bourdain episode everyone talk about so it was a complete shock to me. 

This sandwich is good for when you're hungry, hungover, or a meat lover. Pictures of it doesn't do its justice because the thing is huge. I'm taking it off one star because they wouldn't let me have a beer with it. I think they used to. Something that huge should be enjoyed with a beer, but I guess a soda worked too.
author: Nam T.

description:
Blah blah blah, torta cubana this, torta cubana that. 

Chicken shawarma tastes like nalgas bruh.

I said spicy, not "white-people's definition of spicy".

Let me get my cheetos and bounce.
author: Jose J.

description:
The cubano sandwich is pretty much the only reason why I'd ever come here. TONS of meat.. beef, ham, hot dog, bacon, butter, mayo, eggs, beans, hot sauce, avocado, lettuce, tomato... I'm pretty sure I'm missing a few other ingredients, 'cause this thing is MASSIVE.

Prepare for a food coma afterwards.
author: Vivian H.

description:
Holy Moly - these Cuban sandwiches are HUGE!  I cannot tell you how much stuff is inside of this sandwich.  It must be over 1,000 calories. 
 
If you don't know about this place, it's inside of a small liquor store.  BEWARE: you cannot buy alcohol AND drink it inside the store.  I think they may have previously let you before, but not anymore.  The clerk told me they recently got fined.

The neighborhood can be a little sketched at night so keep your eyes open.
author: Eddie F.

description: I definitely don't recommend coming here at 12 am as my friend and I did. But any other time is golden. I had the Milanesa torta and OHH. AMAZING! Of course I came I here after I saw Bourdain did and it was so worth it! It's a liquor store with a grill but what else do you need! The food was juicy and hit the spot. I can't imagine a better hidden gem in Mission.
author: Gregg O.

description:
The Cubana. Get this torta and you'll achieve food coma like no other. A friend and I embarked on a journey through the streets of Mission late one night to eagerly tantalize our taste buds from this infamous torta made famous by Anthony Bourdain. On this night, our tortas were expertly crafted by a woman who not once winced, to our astonished gazes, as she slathered on the piles of meat and eggs on the griddle. Once prepared and cut in half, all I could utter was, "Damn". I was amazed at the sheer mass of this torta and could only wonder what four digit number would equal out to if Calories were calculated. I only finished half. My friend attempted to finish it off but failed. I couldn't see anyone consuming the whole thing in one sitting. But it was very delicious. It felt like I was eating through a different country with every bite.

After finishing just half of the Cubana, I could feel my tummy bloat and my heart rate sputter. So we decided to expel these symptoms by grabbing King Cobra tall cans from the fridge (brown bagged of course) before we headed out into the unknown. 

This place offers something truly special that you must try at least once in your lifetime to understand and quell any curiosities.
author: Elijah A.

description: The Tortas Cubana from That's it market, drenched in their delicious salsa, is high on the list of things I'd happily eat as a final meal before i die. Get one. Be happy. Live your life.
author: Tis T.

description: I ordered chicken and ham (I didn't know what to get lol) But yep, these sandos are huge! Love jalapenos in it , so good! Had mine for dinner and lunch the next day. I wanna try the other stuff there... quesadillas or tacos, not quite sure what they ordered. Such a humble place, reminded me of Mexico - cute :)
author: Tere C.

description:
Like most people, I came here because this place was featured on Anthony Bourdain's "No Reservations." Sadly, I'm not amazed. Don't get me wrong, the tortas are solid. My girlfriend and I split the Cubano, which was hearty, flavorful, and packed with all sorts of delicious meats and eggs (even a hot dog!!). However, it did leave us feeling super dehydrated b/c of all the salt. That was expected, but given that the flavor was not as amazing as Bourdain portrayed, I felt a little disappointed. To top it off, my girl tried to drink a beer here (as Bourdain did in his show) and the owner told us to put the beer on the floor because it wasn't allowed! I guess you don't get the star treatment unless you'r a celebrity chef here (weird because you're eating in a liquor store for pete's sake!). 

Tables are really small and seating is limited, so come prepared for that!
author: Evonne L.

description:
Maybe we went on an off night? I should have walked out when I got a look at the deli counter case. It was empty, and sure enough, we had to settle for our third order after they kept saying, "sorry, we've run out of that". I was shocked, since it says it's open until 2 am, and it was only 8 pm when we were there. 

I got one of the calzones because there weren't any vegetarian options for sandwiches, and I was growing suspicious of the other items. It was pre-made and saran-wrapped, so I wasn't expecting much. When I asked for it to be heated up (because gross, who wants a cold calzone?), to my surprise, she popped it in the microwave, plastic and sticker and all. 

My friend got a turkey sandwich, and it looked simple enough yet somehow took ages to make. The flavors for both the calzone and sandwich were decent, but not enough to bring us back. I did appreciate the tiny seating area, even if it wasn't the cleanest or classiest. Prices were good, though, at just $10 for both my calzone and the sandwich.
author: Cat N.

description:
Cubano= OMG good!! 
Location= eeek bring your pepper spray
Service= awesome if you speak spanish or go with someone who does!!
author: Mary M.

description: SUCH NICE PEOPLE! The Cuban is the obvious choice, but for the non meat lovers GET THE CHICKEN TORTA! Best thing you will ever eat!
author: Lulu L.

description:
Man that torta was amazing!

Came here around 2pm on a Saturday and it took about 30 minutes to get our tortas made but WOW was it worth it! It was humongous, so I ate half at the counter, and ate the other half the second I got home. There's so much flavor from the various types of meats. Man I can't wait to go back!
author: J. D.

description:
I'm not really a sandwich person, so it usually takes something fairly impressive and flavorful to really grab my attention.  This tiny spot did just that - I wasn't expecting very much but they really put together a great, tasty sandwich.  It was HUGE and filled with a ton of items, including chicken milanesa (flat, breaded chicken cutlet), mayo, sour cream, lettuce, tomato and carrot slaw.  It was very good and had a great flavor from the pan-seared chicken and toasted bread.  

This place is a liquor store so seating is very limited - there are some chairs on the counter and two small tables, which fit about 3 people each...I'd suggest taking the sandwich elsewhere.
author: Ken G.

description:
What can you say about this place:  LEGENDARY!!  

Sure, it's a traditional liquor store, containing a variety of liquor, beer, etc. at semi-reasonable price! However, all you have to do is bypass busy intersection and stand at aww.. at the process of making the most intense sammich in creation, "The Cuban" Torta!  Had one a moment ago; as usual, cannot finish in one setting.  At $10.00, it's a perfect "treat" for both lunch an dinner if sliced in half.  The monstrosity is of cataclysmic proportions, as it's a perfect cheat meal, during your bodybuilding off days; extreme Non-Complex carbohydrates!

Fans - if you haven't tried THE CUBAN torta, then know your role... hang that left.. .hang that right.. stock up for your World Series party, as you can feed a bunch with these.

TWO THUMBS UP!!  =-)
author: Michael M.

description: If you ever find yourself in San Francisco, you definitely have to come check out this place at the Mission District. Wow this is by far the best torta cubana ever!!! I love tortas ~  I usually stick to pollo asado but not here. I had to try the cubana, which did not disappoint me or the rest of the party.  We'll be back for sure...
author: Lupita A.

description:
WOW. cuban torta.

the cuban: breaded steak, pork, chicken, ham, chorizo, bacon, hot dog, avocado, tomatoes, jalapenos, cheese, mayo.

madness. and the wonderful lady who made it is just oh so nice!!
author: Rosalee C.

description:
The Cuban Sandwich is $8 (after the $2 discount) and comes with a TON of meat - breaded beef, hot dog, ham, bacon... and who knows what else. No charge for egg, avocado, butter, onions, mayo... Add Mexican hot sauce and sandwich that all between french bread and you have the biggest, most delicious torta you've ever seen!!!

Note: Causes drowsiness. Don't eat the whole thing at once!
author: Jess C.

description:
I'm taking one star away from perfection because I was not allowed to drink an ice-cold Tecate to wash down my delicious, delicious Cubano.  Why does Anthony Bourdain get special treatment?  Oh yeah wait, never mind.

Liquor store: Check
Greasy, filthy stove: Check
Proprietor lovingly making the best damn sandwich this side of the Mississippi?  You Betcha!

I don't need to say any more.  Order the Cubano and enjoy a little slice of heaven.  Oh, wait, the sandwich is as big as your head.  A big slice of awesome is more like it.

Just bring your lipitor.. something this good made with so many parts of so many animals cannot be good for you, but damn I would gladly trade a few weeks at the end of my life for this heavenly confection.  Those are the worst years anyway, right?
author: Trent L.

description:
BEST TORTA EVER!!!!

Four of us decided to hit this place up after my brother saw Anthony Bourdain eaitng here...

He was not lying... this place was legit.....

We got there a lil to early and the kitchen wasn't opened yet but the guy working made us some mexican coffee and he let us sit down and wait about 30 minutes before the cook arrived..

Four of us split 2 tortas.... DAM that sucker is huge and good.....Have been back several times for this treat in SF...

Good thing the BART is close by!!!!!
author: Lalo R.

description:
Is this sandwich huge? yes. Is there a freaking obscene amount of random meats? yes. Was I excited? yes

I dont get it. It ended up just being a meat barrage in my mouth and I ended up not tasting anything but salt. I also slipped into a deep coma afterwards. 

If I were looking for a huge meal for a decent price and I wanted all these meats, egg, mayo then yeah i'd come here again. However, I dont think I'd really want to eat this again. Too little tastiness for the guilt level of eating something this terrible.
author: Young L.

description:
That's it.

No more grocery shopping.

No more eating out.

No more restaurant quest. http://insidescoopsf.sfgate.com/blog/2011/07/21/meet-the-guy-who-is-trying-to-eat-at-every-san-francisco-restaurant/

Because the Cuban tortas from That's It are so large one sandwich could feed you for life. Not a bad deal for $7.

Problem is the one with breaded chicken, lettuce, tomato and refried beans was so good I could only ration it for two lunches.

These are good problems to have.
author: Jason B.

description:
Ho-LY sandwich, mother of all sandwiches! I got a Torta CUBANA which pretty much includes every single thing ever known to man- salchicas, jamon, pierna, milanesa, chorizo, eggs, pickled jalapenos, cheese, avocado, lettuce tomato among other stuff to help clog your arteries.  I came here right after some Halloween festivities and walked over to this cutesy place and ordered a big one. Man, I'm glad I did.  The sandwich itself is 10 bucks but it's freaking HUGE. Definitely share with a friend, and even that sandwich half will fill you up.  They give you this spicy ass salsa too- which was delicious.  Despite (probably) the masses of people in the store/restaurant being belligerent drunk and retarded during Halloween, the cook and the guy at the register were really nice, professional and were really good sports. 

So, definitely DEFINITELY get the torta cubana, it's an epic sandwich and if you can finish it all in one sitting, props to you!
author: Meena N.

description:
I love hole in the wall places because I always know it's going to be amazing despite the dirtyness.  I heard about this place from Anthony Bourdain's show but when I got there I was really surprised to see how small the place was! I immediately ordered the Torta Cubana because what else could you possibly want from this place??

It was a Sunday night at 11 PM and this place was still open.  I even asked the owner and he said they were open until 2 AM every day which I think is extremely good to know on those late nights that you're out.   I watched him make my amazing sandwich, piling all the different meats and fixins on it.  

It is a mind blowing sandwich- something I've never had before and full of flavor, the bread was buttery, the meat was salty and the avocado, veggies, and jalapenos were a good balance.  It is so huge but so worth the 10 bucks, you have to try it at least once especially if you're ever in the mission.
author: Rachel L.

description:
3.5 stars

If you are on a diet, STAY AWAY. If you don't mind fat, however - you may fall in love with the torta at That's It.

The first bite of the Torta Cubana was gustatively titillating, so much so that I (this is based on my flatmate's testimony, which I'm not sure I believe 100%) made a face/sound that made her feel a little embarrassed for me (and for herself), thus closing the door "for my privacy."

I had to pace myself for the rest of that half. Yes, half was all I could eat - and it took me an entire hour and a half to do it. And then I felt stuffed in a way that doesn't happen very often, even after an elaborate 5-course meal. I credit this to the fact that the Torta Cubana is very greasy, and the fact that it's main ingredients are: fat, more fat, and then some fat sauce in between layers of..... yes, fat. I'm sure it has more calories than twice the daily recommended intake for a male adult. (I'm not a male.. and the "adult" bit is questionable.)

Delicious as that torta is, it's not something you can eat more than once every few months. I won't be going back for a while.. but if I ever crave for fatty goodness (+ extra fat) again, I know where to go.

It contains: Bistek Milanesa (Breaded Steak), Chorizo, Ham, Eggs, Frankfurter, Bacon, Mexican Cheese, Jalapenos, Avocado, Tomato, Sour Cream, Mayonnaise..................................... + FAT.
author: Asha S.

description:
I hate reviewing small hole in the walls that I love because I'm afraid that the yelp curse will kill it for me and cause painful lines that make me question whether or not I'll visit....

Then 'That's It' was featured on Anthony Bourdain's No Reservations, so now I'm pretty sure it has enough publicity that I can let anyone else who wasn't aware that this place exists...

This is not your average market. Inside theres one pretty hardcore grill fully equipped to make you the most badass, meat filled, artery clogging gift from God that you've ever eaten. There is probably 10 different things in this torta, I can't even remember all the different meats and accoutrements, but despite how salty and ridiculously over the top it sounds, it is totally satisfying and in no way too much of anything... The coolness of the sour cream and avocado whisks away any notion of "too much salt" or "too much meat" in this equation. 

I can happily split this with a friend and it will leave us pleasantly satisfied (if not extremely full). The flavors are great, the price is extremely fair, and whats insane about it is that it is all completely unexpected.... you look at this market and think, "hmmm I'm not even sure if I would go there to buy beer." And yet it has soooo much more to offer than pretty much any other market I've been to in the mission...it has the Torta Cubana. Amazing.

So next time you are craving Mexican but you're like, "what other options are there for me besides a burrito or taco?" come here and grab one of these big mothers and take it to go. You will wonder how you went so long without it....
author: Samantha R.

description:
Torta Cubana, what can I say. I came here following all the hype. And I must say, I am thoroughly pleased!

That torta was massive. I could barely finish the first half, let alone the second half. But I hit that hump, a not without some pains from my stomach. I wanna go back and try other things, but what drew me was definitely the Cubana. 

I think I am thoroughly prepared to make this my drunk food, or get food and get all the alcohol behind me since they are also a liquor store!

It's $10, but I guarantee you, it is well worth it. If you are a light-medium eater, split it with a friend; trust me, more filling than a bread-wich from Subways.
author: Michael C.

description:
I honestly had never heard of Cuban Torta before until I saw Anthony Bourdain in San Francisco downing a big thing of Heart-Attack City aka Cubana Torta.

Cuban Tortas at "That's It":
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xixRxmalmT8&amp;amp;feature=related

Anthony Bourdain in San Francisco (No Reservations):
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5p6b6NDJS8A&amp;amp;feature=related

I mean, tell me I'm wrong. This $10 monstrosity is stuffed with the following --grilled and packed in a bun:

- Beef Milanesa (Breaded Steak)
-  Hot Dog
- Chorizo 
- Ham 
- Egg
- Bacon
- Mexican Cheese
- Avocado/Jalapeno/Tomatoes
- Sour Cream and Mayonnaise

The end product was a huge, menacing, scary-looking grilled sandwich. This sandwich either will GROSS you out or make you DROOL.  This torta holds all the stuff I long to eat but don't have the guts to.  And after the two bites that I allowed myself--I declare the sandwich to be INTERESTING AND YUMMY! http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/OVx1jiJRVoZg3jDkPvehQg?select=ZEhsicBc4RwoY5Xgdrc--Q http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/OVx1jiJRVoZg3jDkPvehQg?select=-glUND696LaJW77-8VpdVQ

So if you want to take the challenge, bring your behind (which will be doubled in girth after you finish the Cubana) to That's It Market. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/OVx1jiJRVoZg3jDkPvehQg?select=mQ33gJTMnAmsbjedBGHh_g http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/OVx1jiJRVoZg3jDkPvehQg?select=XOHRpBzC33lPyEy-XDicWQ  It's a liquor store/ counter with 6 stools to eat your tortas.  Grab a wine or beer and watch your Cubana Torta being grilled. Just imagine Anthony Bourdain probably sat on the same seat! How much more interesting could it get?!!!!!

P.S.  This was BF's dinner,  not mine! :)
author: Leah E.

description: Went for a sandwich and they were out of turkey and roast beef. Cuban looked good but was $10. When did sandwiches get so expensive in the mission? Got the vibe she didn't really want to make me anything so ducked out as she took orders in Spanish.
author: tomohisa w.

description: I really wanted to like this place, but unfortunately I got  really sick from eating their torta. As we speak I am dying on the toilet. 2 stars cause it looks good, but man I've been throwing up and having the runs since last night.
author: Lizelle G.

description:
While I am sure the torta is fantastic this review is for the LIQUOR STORE part of "That's it." 


Basically I have caught this guy (with a mustache) over-charging me TWICE. When I corrected him, he just said, "Okay," and charged me the right amount. Which while was nice, I think was just because he KNEW had overcharged me and was just trying to see if he got away with it. 

Also-- all the outsides of ALL the wine bottles are sticky... ew.
author: Emily S.

description: The sandwiches are HUGE!  A regular turkey sandwich was larger than the size of my 7-year old daughter's head!  Needless to say that you can't finish a sandwich in one sitting but they are really delicious.
author: Rose A.

description:
Amazing TORTA CUBANA.  Fast, friendly service.  Parking SUCKS!

I went here on the way to a union meeting nearby because of a coworker's story about the Torta Cubana.  His son had it before, after seeing it on TV, and raved about it, and the ingredients list made my mouth water.

I called in from down the street to order early, and the guy that answered was really friendly and said that two tortas would only take ten minutes.  We got lucky and found parking a block away, but it is an EXTREMELY busy area.  I would recommend ordering to go, and sending someone in to pick up while circling the block.

When we walked in, our tortas had just gotten done being made.  And just the two of them covered up half the grill.  We presented a Yelp coupon, and we were only charged $16!  No tax!  Insanely cheap for the few pounds of miscellaneous meat.

The at least partial ingredients list-- breaded steak, avocado, ham, bacon, hot dog, eggs and chorizo, sour cream, jalepenos, lettuce, tomato.  Initially I was afraid it would just be one big salty meaty mess in my mouth, but my first bite put those fears to rest.  It was AMAZING.  It wasn't too salty, and the mixed flavors didn't clash at all.  You could taste each ingredient individually-- it truly was like eating and tasting a bunch of different meats at once.  I personally could have used a little more heat from the mild jalepenos, but that's just an extra the sandwich didn't need to be one of the most delicious I have ever had.  It was more than enough for two meals.  You can't beat two meals for ten bucks!  Unless of course you've got that coupon and its eight.  =)

The place is really a liquor/convenience store with a little grill and a few seats around it.  For food, to go would probably be a better option.  They also have a bunch of sandwich, falafel, mediterranean type options, although I don't know if I would ever be able to get anything other than the Cubano on the rare occasions that I'm out in the Mission.

I dont know when, but I will definitely be back.  FO SHO!  lol...
author: Jon B.

description:
I tried the chicken torta and was able to eat the entire thing but didn't need to eat again for another 24hrs. The only draw back to this deli is there is a constant flow of people coming in to buy Marlboro and Modelo but if you can get over the fact that your eating in an old dirty liquor store the food is great. I'll be back to try their other tortas in the near future. 

The price is right the food is amazing and the granite counter is kept exceptionally clean. The woman that was making my torta was exceptionally friendly and made the experience very enjoyable.
author: Justin S.

description: Just like in another review, upon walking up to this place, it looks major sketch. The cubana torta is very delicious. Why on earth would you go here for anything else. Order it, you won't be disappointed. Eggs, some hotdogs, chorizo, a slice of ham. What more could you ask for? Do yourself a favor and order it.
author: John W.

description:
Wow I totally had forgotten about this place. Only hard core locals and the very curious would visit this place.  The fact that it showed up on No Reservations was a complete surprise. The large sign outside:

"The Center of the Mile" 

Never figured out what that meant and still don't. Besides offering tortas,  mediterranean food, liqour, porn and smokes they often have a random selection of awesome sodas. 

For those of you who are curious about the Cubana, the ingredients are

- Ham
- Beef milanesa (breaded beef steak)
-  Mexican hot dog/sausage (salchicha de pavo)
- Chorizo
- Avocado
- Jalapenos
- egg
- cheese
- some sort of special soft torta bread

You can also find these style tortas at the various 3-4 La Casita Chilanga locales in Redwood City also. The tortas are monsters and look off putting but they're delicious.

Strange ass place but I reckon now that it's gotten exposure, the people will come out of the wood work now. It's no longer going to be the sketch corner market it once was.
author: Kim N.

description:
Ok ok ok. Why two stars? Because everything BUT the tacos/cubana/foods made there is super overpriced. 
This is my closest deli and yet I never go here because my alcoholic self drinks way too much to overpay by 2 dollars every day I go to buy booze. If i went here, I would probably waste more than 300 dollars in a year on my drinking habit. So I walk around the corner to the place on Capp and 24th to buy my reasonably priced booze. However, this place does stay open until super late. Did i mention it is overpriced? ugh.
author: Kristin T.

description:
I'll have what Anthony Bourdain is having please, the Torta Cubana! 

Oh how I love the mission area. That's it Market is a true hidden gem in San Francisco. Behind the counter is a lady who makes these incredible Tortas.  $10 and worth every penny.  This would make great munchies for after drinking. No hangover the next day!
author: Christina W.

description:
I came here merely because i heard that the torta cubana was featured on No Reservations.

TOTALLY worth the $7 for the torta! you see them make it right in front of you, you can guide them or tell them what no to put on it... and it easily serves 2 people... or just one of me ;)

you really need to try it, hidden behind the guise of a corner store... this place serves some delicious cuban tortas!
author: Leo M.

description:
It's Bourdain recommended... why not order a torta which is "just wrong on all levels"? so that's what we did on a sunny Friday afternoon gallivanting in the Mission. 
Upon entering we saw the three hipsters thoroughly enjoying their tortas at the small roundabout counter (maybe can seat 6 peeps) ... I was already planning to swoop in to take their seats after they had devoured their sammies.
Alicia took our orders: 2 Cubanos, but I opted for the fried chicken patty (milanesa). I felt the Cubano would be too much MEAT which consisted of 1 large breaded beef cutlet, pork chorizo w/ 2 eggs,  a hot dog (I kid you not), and a slice of a deli ham... slapped together in margarine grilled soft french bread and spread with mayo and sour cream, garnished with tomato, pickled jalapenos/carrots, shredded ice burg lettuce... topped with Queso fresco and an avocado. We grabbed our drinks from the fridge in the back, paid the guy at the counter, 3 sandwiches $28 (they're really big sammies) and 3 sodas = 33 bucks. A little steep for a mission lunch from what I remember, but it's San Francisco... wateves...
I took a bite of the hubs Cubano, a little salty  for my taste buds, but my eating companions enjoyed theirs. I like my torta with just the milanesa. Soft bread and went great w/ the with same  garnishing guts ... white soft Mexican cheese, lettuce, jalapenos, tomatoes, and avocado.
We loved talking with Alicia, warm and extremely friendly. She said she's been extremely busy since she was featured on the show, "muy busy" she exclaims, wiping her forehead =D She's very grateful and appreciative of all the fans and the great business. She's even got a new lady to help her now.... they're really nice, hardworking folks. We'll see here again soon, gotta try her quesadillas!
author: Aga O.

description:
Yes, I did re-watch the Bourdain San Francisco episode before heading down on vacation.  However, I didn't plan to run into this joint, it ran into me.  My buddy and I were checking out The Mission and worked up an appetite.  The light shined down and That's It appeared. 

Me to my friend, "OMG, that's the place Anthony Bourdain went to with the head sized tortas, girl!"

My friend, "Sh*t, let's do it!"
