It was relatively early, only about noon and hardly anyone around on a sleepy President's Day Monday.  I innocently asked, "what's the best torta?" and the sweet lady behind the counter replied, "The Cubana.  It is the BEST!"

From seeing the show I knew we should split this sandwich and jesuschrist, I was right.  Our tummies were about split after eating our half tortas.

Sure, the idea of bacon, hot dog, steak, egg, avocado, cheese, mayo and MORE mayo and tomato may sound abominable to some, but it was sinfully delicious and one of my favorite dining excursions in this foodie city.  Probably because it was so down home.  The green salsa on the side was delicious.  You don't think you need it, but you do.  

My friend commented that she wanted to fold the little lady behind the counter and put her in her pocket because she was so cute and nice.  She really took care of us and you can tell that she knows everyone in the neighborhood as different folks came and went, sitting at the counter and talking to her in turn.

What was interesting is that the cashier man on the other side of the store was a distinguished older Middle Eastern man.  I think that's what is really awesome about San Fran is how cultures mix here like it ain't no thing.  He was a real character for sure and I'm not sure what conspiracy theory he was trying to relay to me about the credit card people, but whatever.  You don't need a Mission Burrito, you need a That's It Torta!
author: Meg B.

description:
Cubano Torta= Freakshow of a sandwich, but only tastes ok.

I guess lots of people ate the Torta trying to relive Bourdains experience.

Mines wasnt as big as the one Ive seen in the show or on yelp pics. I guess different cooks make it differently.

Cheap ass welfare hotdogs and only one egg/ bacon?
author: vin t.

description: Love this place Maria makes the bomb Cubana tortas!! You won't regret it, is better than the one in Harrison 24th, fresh meat, plus she's very nice. To call in for an order you don't need to wait, is usually done before you arrive.
author: Xochitl F.

description:
As someone who spends most of his Valentines Days alone (in part because my contraceptive of choice is my personality), I made a decision a few years ago to do something extraordinarily manly every V-Day I'm single. These "man-fests" have ranged from going suit shopping, to climbing tall mountains and bellowing affirmations of my awesomeness to pesants in the vales below. This year, I decided to eat something ridiculously large, the Torta Cubana at "That's It Market", made famous by the most manly of Television personalities, Anthony Bourdain.

This sandwich would be remarkable for the wide variety of meats it includes: Breaded Steak, Chicken, Ham, Bacon, Hot Dogs, Chorizo and Eggs. However, not being a sandwich for mere mortals, the Cubana also includes a maddening combination of Jalapenos, Refried Beans, Mayo, Lettuce, and Cheese within its ludicrously proportioned eight-inch girth.

Jesus Christ, I got a post-traumatic case of the meat sweats along with some heart palpitations from even listing that ungodly combination of ingredients. Talk about things I couldn't eat if I were in a relationship...

However, sandwiches like this are not truly complete without a bitchin sauce to round out the flavor. In this case, the sauce came in the form of Thats It's face-scorchingly spicy red salsa--enhanced with a touch of citrus, fresno chile and some delightfully chunky onion- and rich and smokey chipolte sauce, chocolate in color and reminiscent of the finer mole sauces I've eaten in my life. While the lady at the counter clearly thought I was crazy simply by virtue of my request for "as many Jalapenos as you can fit on this thing", and for going at this sandwich alone, my request for the "spiciest salsa you can wrangle up" was apparently noteworthy enough for all of her co-workers to leave their posts and come watch the white boy erupt into flames. While the crowd slowly mulled around me, I dug in.

How was the sandwich itself? Well, without the salsa, it was sort of a mess. And by a mess, I mean it got all over my (formerly white) shirt, my hands, my beard and my mustache. Without the salsa, the flavors were kind of a mess too, one bite would be chorizo and bacon (which I would have liked a little more of) the next hot dog and processed ham (whichI certainly could have used far less of). But, when anchored by the slick, lava-like burn of the salsas, what resulted was an unusualy textured (the toasted french loaf contrasting with the beans, breaded steak and eggs was especially nice), salty, and undeniably bitchin' meal, which, for a mere ten dollars was enough to feed a small family in a war-torn country...or at least giant enough to help repair the ego and self-image of a Graduate Student on his least favorite holiday. That, and the fact that I finished eating with an audience watching made it a worthy feat to crown my otherwise inglorious Valentine's Day an immortal testamant to my manliness.
author: Casey U.

description: The Torta Cubana I ate here is massive, epic, and unparalleled.    In fact, I couldn't even finish *half* of the sandwich that was placed in front of me.    It tasted absolutely fabulous but the only way I could have eaten any more is if they'd provided a Roman-style vomitorium for me to use during my meal.     It's been said and resaid by everybody, and granted it has to be epic if it made Anthony Bourdain's "No Reservations," but the sandwich I got here is a jumbo sized handful of meaty and heart stopping goodness.    I guess I'll see how well the 2nd half of my sandwich holds up when I eat it later today or tomorrow.
author: David O.

description:
Finally made it here to try this famous Cuban sammy that Anthony Bourdain raved about.

Let's just make it clear now that this is not your typical Cuban Sammy. By the way, this joint is a liquor and wine store located half way point of Mission St. 

Sharing is caring! This Sammy is as big as your normal size plate. My boyfriend and I shared it. Now, let's talk about the layers of meat goodness: breaded, thinly pounded beef, pork sausage, chicken, pork leg, ham, and bacon!!!! 

The bread is toasted and holds the goodies well. I got everything in it. 

Bring your appetite and be ready to walk and shop after because you're going to need to walk it off!!!
author: Malou M.

description:
Oh LordY... you cannot miss this place.  Theres a fat sign that says something about the 'largest torta cubana'... 

What I do remember was watching the sweet lady making 6 torta cubanas. We put her to work all she had to say was "wow 6?!" to us asian folks.  Ya know, we eat A LOT and somehow most of us can eat and not gain a freakin pound.  I secretly wonder if the people in the area ever wonder how asians do it...I wonder myself sometimes.

TORTA CUBANA:  grilled hot dogs, bacon, chorizo/scrambled eggs, slice of ham, and milanese (lightly breaded and crisp beef), and thin slice of avocado, lettuce, mayo, tomato, cheese

My complaint: a sliver of avocado ..for a huge torta.. not impressed.

Because of her hard work slapping those buttery loaves of bread with fatty meats and all the fixings, she got a nice tip. 

MmM baby, let me tell you, the smell was heaven but then my cousin whispered: "i feel my arteries clogging already'.   I told him we only live once.  

Oh and it HIT THE SPOT!  I can eat, and I was content, not stuffed, with just half a sandwich.  A half is the perfect size for lunch.  I vow to never eat this type of torta more than once every three months to keep my health from going downhill.  It's going to be hard to follow, but I must!  

By all means, you should try. I would have to say my favorite place is still in SJ..
author: Kimberly C.

description:
Had to admit that the only reason why my hubby and I made the trek to this place is because it was featured on Anthony Bourdain's show, "No Reservations". 
Greasy, fatty, and exploding with flavor. Fried egg, chicken, pork, ham, bacon. breaded beef, avocado, mayo, lettuce, tomato, onion, jalapeno, all nicely layered on some really yummy soft bread. (I mean really, need I say more?) It's hard to believe this place literally has 2 tiny tables and like 6 chairs, oh and is actually a convenience store. But that's okay, because it was grub. ;)
author: Marcy H.

description: Saw this place on "Anthony Bourdain's No Reservations" and decided to try it....LOVED IT  I was a little intimidated when I saw the lady adding everything she did to the sandwich but once I bit into it TOTAL AWESOMENESS...must try
author: Nancy A.

description:
Huge and delicious torta.

I stumbled here one night. With some friends and we shared the amazing torta. Don't remember much else except that it was a great deal and everybody really enjoyed it.
author: Stephen S.

description:
Torta Cubana is the ONLY way to go.  I don't know whether these are authentic DF style as they purport to be.  I honestly don't really care.  The Cubana is $10 and worth every penny.

I will be the first one to admit that I love to eat and, when I first saw the torta, I thought I could totally eat it by myself (luckily I was splitting one so didn't even get to try).  After splitting one twice, and being completely full both times, I can honestly say that this thing is huge and should definitely be split by two people.

This is NOT the place to go if you have issues with unsanitary food making, e.g. the woman who makes the tortas totally doesn't follow the wash your hands after handling certain things rule.  I've been to countries with way worse sanitary concerns so this doesn't really bother me all that much.

The question here isn't whether you should go (obv you should).  The real question is how fast can you get to That's It :).
author: Banana S.

description: Definitely try the torta cubana when coming here. This was probably one of the best tortas I have ever had. If you have never tried it here then you have never had a torta to the max. I am not even even going to tease you with the ingredients. Just go here and become surprised. Because either way the torta cubana is a combination of deliciousness.
author: Sonlay V.

description:
It was that curiousity itch that got me to try this sandwich as I saw Anthony Bourdain munchin on this big sammy and he looked pleased.

Hmmm, a friend of ours asked my husband to bring her to Eagle Loans since some of her loans will soon expire. So we went together with my son and another housemate. After she finished her thing, we went at Thats It. My husband was hesitant at first because it is not parking friendly and some hoohah about the place itself... 

We got a nice parking spot across the store and me and my husband went to cross the street and found ourselves ordering the Cuban sandwich.

It is 7-11 type of store in an old building. Not hard to find too... I find it clean and the man at the register greeted us when we walked in. As well as the lady in the kitchen counter. We ordered our Cuban sandwich. I noticed that the kitchen area is open but there were no flyiing insects or craling ones but it is a tad oily everywhere. I began to feel icky by that time hehe... The sammy was cooked infront of us for about 5 minutes and when I saw her stacked the meat inside the sandwich I began to think "Am I really going to eat that?" This is not a negative thing okay its just that I dont have a gallbladder anymore so any oily food will make me cringe in pain at night if you know what i mean.

The Cuban is tasty, big and a new spectacle for me since Im just starting to explore other kind of cuisine in the area. And I would definitely recommend it to a friend. But as for me, I would rather go to Quiznos or Subway.
author: Shiela D.

description:
Saw a repeat episode of Bourdain in High-Definition few days ago, the episode was San Francisco. In HD the sandwich looked huge and good, I must try.

After a seminar I attended in SF, late lunch time, meter parking nearby (.75 for 23min).

One couple ahead of me when I walked in, I ordered the ham&cheese Cubana to-go, 15min later, $10, and I was outtathere, the couple was still there waiting I don't know what they ordered but it seemed it was their first time. It was 50min drive before I could eat it. And eat I did.

The sandwich is huge, no kidding!!
The sandwich was good, bready and meaty.

(pics added)
author: qirk z.

description:
5 stars all the way for the sumptuous breaded chicken torta. I love it so. I literally eat one of these enormous sammichez a week. Sometimes the customer service is stretched a little thin. Sometimes I pre-order by phone, get here 20 minutes later, and it's still not ready.  But... for the most part, things usually work out. And anyway, one bite out of the chicken torta and all grudges are swept away.  This is that kinda food.. that kind that you crave, and when you crave it no other torta, no other place will do. And i have had some yummy tortas in my time here on earth.  The Cubana gets a lot of attention, but I have not tried it.  There is no reason for me to try it though. When you find something you love so much why would you order something else? ... I am not exactly sure why the chicken torta is so over-the-top deicious.  I suspect it is everything (including jalepenos), the creamy white cheesy sloppy crispy, with the tangy tomato, on  lightly fried loaf of bread (yes, i said loaf, and I am only slightly exaggerating) but... there really is something about the flavor of the breaded chicken.  My jordanian boyfriend said that the flavor is actually that of middle eastern chicken that has been pounded out. After visiting Jordan and tasting the chicken he described I have to agree.. he's on to their secret.  
Please, dont feel you have to have the Cubana. The chicken is all I will EVER need and, in my opinion its absolute heaven.
author: Amphianda B.

description:
This place is a lot bigger than it looks on No Reservations, but it is definitely cool. It is worthwhile just to go and eat the massive all inclusive torta cubana. It was perfect to split with another person...though I am not going to lie, I probably could have eaten the whole thing. I would have just been in some serious pain afterwards.

I will say I am pretty sad that I could not drink a beer there like Tony did...but it was tasty without cerveza.
author: Caitlin H.

description: The lovely women who make the food here are always so attentive and put a lot of love into the work they do, which shows in the amount of flavor that comes in each bite. Yes, the cubana is a feast alone but the other items on the menu are delectable in their own light. The 4 is because every time I go they run out of something and I have to order another item. Having a hankering for something and not being able to feed it can be sad. And the space can be incredibly awkward to order and eat in when there is a heavy traffic flow, having people cut others in 'line' (if that word can even be used).
author: Karen M.

description:
I would have walked by this place had I not been at a red light waiting to cross the street, and noticed the sign advertising the tortas. You walk in and to your left is the typical 'liquor store' finds (chips, soda, beer), but its the little counter on the right side of the establishment that should bring you here.

I did not order a Cuban torta....or the artery clogger....but I did try the chicken sandwich. It is huge! The combination of avocado, meat, jalapenos and bread make me weak in the knees. I was unable to eat the monster torta in one sitting, but my inner fat kid sure wanted me to.
author: Hilda Z.

description: you order torta cubana and a lady makes it right in front of you.   oboy humongous!  delicious but there's no way you can finish all by yourself.  you need someone to half&half.
author: Jee C.

description:
Had the Cuban Torta sandwich.  It was insanely mad.  I think I sucked down that juicy egg, meaty, sandwich in 10 seconds...

I must've been hungry.  But definitely not disappointed.
author: Tony U.

description: Best Torta I've ever have. No other shall compare! This place is also open late. And! It's in this little liquor/market so if you want, you can buy a six pack of beers and normal grocery store price, sit down and drink some beer while enjoying this amazing Torta. It's no wonder why it was featured on Anthony Bourdain's No Reservations!
author: Jacqueline N.

description:
The BEST Cubana in the WORLD! SO GOOD! MUST GO! The sandwich is so BIG two people can eat it.

Go check it out ASAP!
author: Jasmine P.

description:
This possibly could be the world's largest torta as they proudly advertise. Unbelievable. 

The one time I had it, it was all I ate that weekend. That's right, I portioned it into 6 meals! Breakfast/lunch/dinner for 2 whole days. What's in it? 

Beef milanesa (breaded beef steak), hot dog, ham, chorizo, 2 eggs, jalapeno, cheese on a soft Mexican bread. I hope one or two people went vegan that weekend. Also: 

1. They take credit cards. 
2. Close to 24th St. Bart. 
3. Next to Mission Bar. 
4. There is seating. 

This is my favorite tortaria in SF, hands down. Will come by when I feel like cheating.
author: Angelo F.

description: Torta Cubana- epic lunch I had with a friend yesterday.  SO good.  You really should split one with someone.  Best thing ever.  The lady making these was a star.  Scrumptiousness.
author: Lisa M.

description: The best Cuban Torta in San Francisco.. nay the world! Fidel has never tasted something so good.  Watching it being made right in front of you is part of the show, but come hungry.
author: Noe A.

description:
I watched the Giants v. Niners game at Mission Bar next door and had an appetite worth ordering the freakishly huge creation called the "Cubana Torta." The Cubana torta consists of eggs, one bacon slice, chorizo, breaded beef, ham, cut up hot dog wedges in between two toasty pieces of bread topped with guacamole, mayo, tomato slices and Mexican cheese. After watching her prep the bad boy, I think I'd fare better healthwise splitting the sando. It's quite a ghastly sight seeing it and knowing the contents would be in your mouth within minutes. 

I split the beast with my bf telling him this is no comparison to the pork roll he served me with when I visited Jersey.
author: Rachel C.

description:
Saw Anthony Bourdain's show on Netflix and decided to go get a Torta Cubana. For $10 ($8 with Yelp page printed out)  it easily fed both me and my girlfriend.

It was a heaven of meatiness and the bread was perfectly crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside, which made the whole thing very pleasant to eat without jaw cramps. 

The final 5th star is missing because although the meat flavors were very rich and fresh, the sandwich could have benefited from some sort of sauce to give a more interesting flavor profile.
author: Felix B.

description:
My partner had never had a torta before and I had never been to That's It, so we decided our Friday treat would be a visit here.  It's primarily a corner market but tucked away on the right side is a very small kitchen.  We were greeted warmly and took a couple of stools at the counter so we could watch the tortas being cooked.
My partner had the Cubana which is made with breaded beef steak, pork sausage, ham, bacon and chorizo with scrambled eggs between a large, soft roll, mayo, avocado, tomatoes and sour cream.
That was a bit much for me so I ordered a simple chorizo with eggs torta.  It was ready in minutes and we got really hungry smelling the tortas on the way home.
Once we unwrapped them, we both knew we could eat only half.  But it was delicious.  I didn't think mayo would work with chorizo, but it helped cut the spiciness and hotness.  We were both very happy.
I would love to return and try the torta milanesa!
author: Philip C.

description:
its almost a joke how big the Torta Cubana  is. It has everything in it. Yes it does cost $10, but theres no way that I could finish one alone. 

Split one and it was the perfect size. 

I think it has every meat possible inside? ham, milanesa, chorizo, pork leg. what am i missing? there was some egg in there. all the fixins. 

ignore the crack heads and sit at the counter with a thing of hot sauce. good times.
author: J A.

description:
Can be a little pricey, but it's certainly convenient. I work up the street, so this place is great for me. It's your basic corner bodega.

In a neighborhood full of more taquerias than a native New Mexican boy can possibly handle (that's a BIG chore, let me tell you) you sometimes need a break from the carnitas and carne asada. Until I found this place I had to hunt and peck for a simple sandwich. It sounds ridiculous, but it's hard to find a straight up sandwich joint in The Mission that's not doubling as a coffee bar. So yay for That's It Market in that regard.

The liquor is a little overpriced, and the other items, too (sandwiches excluded). I also don't like that they don't take cards here. Boo. Of course, however, they have an ATM you can pay a stupid fee to draw money out of.
author: Wes T.

description:
So I admit like most people after watching Anthony Bourdain eat the Cubana sandwich I decided I must come here. This sandwich is a smorgasborg of meats. If you're hung over eat this sandwich. If you're a healthy eater don't eat this sandwich. If you can eat alot eat this sandwich. If you are a light eater eat half and save the other half for later.

Seriously. This behemoth of a sandwich has everything you might imagine - beef, bacon, ham, hot dog, avocado, tomato, and even some lettuce. 

I can eat this thing maybe once or twice a year.
author: David C.

description:
Hot Deal Alert!!!! Ok so we went to this place thinking that how good can it be, it's in a bodega name That's it. Man, we were wrong the Cuban Torta was so good, there was a least one from each animal. There was Chorizo, Ham, Milanesa, Hot Dog, and Egg plus mayo and avocado. The hot sauce was just delicious and I think it might have been home made. 

Then I went to pay for the sandwiches, 10$ tax included. FML this place might kill me.
author: Cameron H.

description:
Cubana is huuuuuge and ridiculous! My friend placed our order in Spanish (helped me to get the full experience,) and we sat at the counter and watched the lady go to work with a vast amount of ingredients taking up the whole griddle. It took a while but it was worth it. I grabbed a tall can of Tecate beer on the way out and headed to the park to enjoy a lunch of epic proportions!

BTW, I can eat a good amount and only put down half of the torta.
author: Nick A.

description:
Whoa! Go with the cubana torta and be sure to share one with a friend. I stopped in today with my boyfriend and I'm now feeling slightly inadequate as he sat there with sweat on his brow and a tired look of satisfaction in his eyes. 
This place gets cool points for being in a liquor store. Scratch that. This place is a liquor store that serves awesomely epic tortas. 
Yes, we came here because it was on tv.  Don't judge. 
Oh......its in a very sketchy neighborhood but I'm from Chicago so I know good food is to be had in places you can only visit in the day with a big dude.
author: Tiffany Y.

description: Yes, I went in search of the Torta Cubana. There are 3 seats at the counter and 4 right next to it so if you plan on going at a normal meal time don't plan on eating there. Also, this is a liquor store (where all the best sandwiches come from) and as we grabbed a beer and paid for the meal beforehand we found out we can't drink inside?! Beware of that. All was forgiven though when I was handed a giant hulk of food. Assuming you know what's in the behemoth it's worth the price. If you can get more sauce on the creature the better as it can be a bit dry (especially if you only have a sealed beer nearby). This is a meal to cross of the list, just make sure you don't have to make it up a stereotypical SF hill afterwords...it may take you awhile.
author: Michael C.

description:
What's it?  As in some kind of identification like: that's it!  Das the one, that behemoth caloric mothership gonna be some divine reincarnation of a flabby 295 pound sandwich whore?  Or like: that's it!  NO FREAKING MAS, my bowels can't take...it...anymore?  You know I couldn't verify whether it's indeed the "world's largest" because that's a lot more globetrotting plus torta-scavenging desirable given the number of meals I have left on this oil steeped planet, and this strange crusty little liquor store-mini mart-deli is probably counting on that sort of detachment.  

Sweet Alicia, the mama of the house, takes a really flat, large roll (let's call them your college dorm bed pillows) and griddles them over  melted pools of butter, lathers them with sour cream and queso, then piles them with shredded lettuce, tomato slices, jalapenos, onions, half a softened, ripe avocado, then somehow artfully defying gravity, smooshes it all together with layers of breaded fried steak, not one, but two eggs scrambled w/ chorizo (con mas butter), BACON, sliced deli ham (butter!  I said mas!), hot dogs and finally sprinkles the top with tongue numbing hot sauce.  It's so big that 2 sheets of butcher paper can't even stretch its way around the girth.   I mean, why not throw in some SPAM, a quarter cup of corned beef and some Vienna sausages while you're at it?  

Neverminding claims, it's taken me about a week to develop a posture about this "Tony Bourdain" special much less digest it, and I've decided (despite having figured out what initially possessed me to put it in my mouth) that after having picked out the horrific rubbery dogs, ham and hot sauce, it wasn't half bad (tasting).  It's salty, creamy, crispy, squishy, hot and cool all in one to two mortifying bites.  It's the kind of thing you split casually among friends or foes and never set back down on your plate unless you're ready to put that fork to use.  But can you really say you appreciate something when you have to deconstruct the original, not enjoying something in the way the creator intended?
author: Irene S.

description:
So this place is now famous because of Mr. Bourdain and yes it is why I tried it.  Without it showing up on "No Reservations", many would not know about it.  

That's it Market is exactly what you expect.  A corner store with a greasy grill of delicious food where you can pull a cold beer directly out of the wall coolers.  My friend had the "Cuban Torta" and it is a monster of a sandwich.  Does it provide monster flavor?  Not exactly.  However, it is something that one should go with if this will be your only time here.  However, be aware of the grey looking hot dog included.

I myself had some sort of chicken and sausage torta that was unbelievably flavorful and exactly what I needed after a few hours of afternoon drinking.  

So if you are in the hood, check it out.  You'll get cheap food that is good and solid.
author: Keith J.

description:
My boyfriend and I visited this place after he saw a review of their world's largest cubana sandwich. The sandwich was ten dollars flat and let me tell you, that thing was gigantic! If you cut it up, you can probably feed four people HAHA. 

It was quite good it had: eggs, chorizo, meat, lettuce, cheese, hot dogs?, ham, and I forget what else. It was hot, fresh, and made right in front of you. Plus, the lady who works there is supeeeer sweet! 

Give this place a try if you're in the area!
author: Karen L.

description: After watching Anthony Bourdain, I was tempted to come try the torta cubana. I really wanted to love it but, sadly, I was left disappointed. Yes, the tortas are huge--bigger than most people's faces but the variety of meats hardly have any flavor at all. To me, it's just a sandwich that has the capacity to raise my cholesterol level by about 30 points in one sitting but, really, I'd rather save it for something more worth while for my tastebuds. Also, unlike what you may have seen on Bourdain's show, you CANNOT grab a beer and drink it with your meal. Ultimately, THAT'S IT is just yet another over-hyped hipster joint that is good, but not GREAT. Personally, I think it's way over-priced at $10 a pop for the quality and variety of meat.
author: Brian M.

description: Customer service great..cabanas even better. Recommend this anytime
author: Charles O.

description:
I love this place... I'd never been in a Mexican "cantina" with Al-Jazeera blasting on the TV.  We must have timed our visit right as we got there and 6 out of the 7 seats were empty.  We waited a few minutes for the lady to come back from who-knows-what? but weren't in a hurry so we didn't mind.

We ordered the Cubana, famous after T. Bourdain featured it on his show... and a chicken quesadilla.  The Cubana is definitely big enough for two though it was so good, I wanted to eat the whole thing myself.  I'd probably have it without mayonaise next time however.  

About timing it right... by the time we left, we had seen at least 6 people order tortas and there was a line almost out the door.  I guess we weren't the only ones that wanted to check it out.
author: Andres D.

description:
My crush on Anthony Bourdain is over--thanks to the Torta de Cubano from this sandwich stand in a liquor store. Our palates just aren't compatible and a relationship just wouldn't work out.

Although the torta was a cheap monster (only $8 after the $2 off coupon on this page), size doesn't matter to me when it comes to sandwiches--and only sandwiches. 

Does anyone really need breaded steak, hot dog, bacon, ham, chorizo, and eggs, all generously grilled with butter, between two slices of bread? I could barely get my mouth around that, let alone the avocado, lettuce, tomato, and creamy condiments.

My friend and I shared the beast and neither of us could finish our portion. We were disappointed because it seemed like weren't even eating the same sandwich. Her half had all hot dog, bacon, and ham, and mine had all the chorizo and egg. The lady behind the counter is sweet, but she needs to spread the sandwich better. No bacon? No love.

This really is the biggest torta in the world, but it is completely unnecessary if you're under 6'5" and 250 pounds. Sorry, Bourdain, I'm going back to crushing on Giada de Laurentiis now.
author: Liz T.

description:
Amazing!  I have always avoided this corner market because it is sketchy.  Very NY style liquor store/deli & grill in the Mission with a dirty plastic banner in front that reads "Worlds Largest Torta".  C'mon, sketchy.  But home-girl inside whipped me up a Cuban Torta that'll make you slap yo mama and not even apologize.  Here's how it went down... 

Tonight, Sunday, I ordered it.  Eggs, ham, beef steak, bacon, hot dogs, sour cream, mayo, pickled jalapenos & carrots, avocados, cheese, chorizo, tomato, lettuce on thick and crunchy yet soft bread.  Damn, seriously? When sista-girl threw all that meat and eggs on the grill I looked around and said to myself "she must be doin' a phone order for 5 people because I'm the only one in here and she can't possibly fit all that on two slices of bread."  Total Candid Camera moment.  And sure enough, five minutes later, Baaam!  She wrapped it up and I bounced.  I could have eaten it there but the dude working on the liquor store side is shady mcgrady and I wasn't feeling his vibe.  Plus, if you're single and looking for love, you most definitely do not want anyone seeing you attack this $10 sandwich.

I could only eat half and by the time I'm hungry again it'll probably be Wednesday so I advise splitting it with a friend.  So what if my cholesterol shot up and I gained 10lbs?  Don't judge me.  

The five stars is for the food.  Hands down the best torta I have ever had.   Is it the world's largest as they claim?  If there is one bigger please let me know. 

When it comes to outrageously big and delicious sandwiches in SF, That's It Market takes the cake or I guess it takes the Torta.
author: Perry D.

description:
I had heard about this on the show "No Reservations" and without getting a recomendation it is not a place I would have ever tried, it's a liqueur store for goodness sake.  The sandwich on the show seemed insane so it is one of those things you have to try once. There are only 4 seats at the counter and two small tables so you may have to wait for a seat because this is definitely not a sandwich you can eat on the run. 

The sandwich was as big as your head with every farm animal on it. We split the Torta Cubana. It had ham, bacon, hot dogs, eggs, chorizo, breaded beef steak, lettuce, tomato, cheese, mayo and an avocado sauce; all for $10 and with my $2 YELP coupon, only $8 (Thanks YELP). 

Unless your a growing teenage boy or want leftovers, splitting it is plenty, it held me through out the day. I think this is the perfect hangover breakfast sandwich.
author: Dianne M.

description:
This has got to be one of the best sandwiches I've ever had. Even my sister who typically hates sandwiches, loves the Torta Cubana. 

Actually had a quarter of the Torta today for lunch. Me eating just a quarter of a sandwich is unheard of. This just shows you how big these suckers really are.

Super friendly woman behind the counter that makes it. She's actually the one that invented this Cuban Torta.

This is a definite must try!
author: Rocky S.

description: Had the tinga tacos and a milanesa torta.  The tinga was tender, juicy, and well spiced.  Served with queso fresco and fresh salsas on a home made tortilla.  Simply delicious.  The Milanesa was thin cut, lightly breaded and perfectly fried.  Well spiced and accompanied.  The bread was absolutely perfect.  Great price, great food, definitely a must if you are craving a great torta.
author: Cody P.

description:
Came here after a night perusing the Mission. In a drunken stupor I hastily agreed to everything my friend was suggesting we get. Friendly workers at this little market, just a few hours before we were buying tall boys of Modelos, now we were back, but replacing the tall boys with Vitamin Waters and a pack of Parliaments. I went outside for a quick smoke and came back into something that sobered me up by just looking at it.

Apparently what was bestowed in front of me was the infamous Cubano sandwich. Christ. This was just everything in a slaughterhouse between two fried pieces of bread. There was beef, there was ham, there was sausage, there was cheese, there was probably 5 pounds of fat, and a medley of other heart clogging delicacies. I will never forget the night that one sandwich defeated three grown men, however I foresee a rematch...
author: John B.

description:
OMG, this place has that ridiculous Cubana.

I don't know what else to say, That's it! Get It!

Note to anyone that goes: Order a Cubana Sandwich, make sure to cut it in half and give it to your friend, if you eat the whole damn thing, you might get a heart attack
author: Eric A.

description:
I went to That's It Market today with a couple of my friends. We all tried the famous Cubana Tortas that they are known for, and overall, they're pretty good. You really get bang for your buck. We got the steak Cubana torta.

Like others on here have said about the reviews, the Tortas are huge. It's really unbelievable how big those Tortas are. They're filled with hot dog, eggs, your choice of meat, and many other ingredients. It was pretty good overall. I was full after. Next time we go there, I might try the Chicken Cubana Torta.
author: Otis B.

description:
After seeing the GIGANTE sandwiches on No Reservations we wanted to try this place out. Ok the Cubana should really be renamed the Heart Attack on a Hoagie!! This thing had breaded beef, hot dogs, ham, a fried egg, sour cream, cheese, oh and let's not forget the couple pieces of shredded lettuce.

All in all it was a tasty sammie, but I just can't justify the amount of calories to ingest one of these (I can only assume one is about 2000 cal).

The woman making the Cubanas doesn't speak much English, but she's really sweet and you can tell she takes pride in what she does.
author: Rana A.

description:
I finally tried the torta Cubana here and it was way tastier than I expected. It was also bigger than my head but I knew what I was getting into. As the other reviews have covered, it consists of an insane pile of five different kinds of meats plus eggs. I don't think I'm going to be rushing back to eat it again but it's definitely something that's worth eating every now and then. 

As a liquor store, they have standard corner store ripoff prices. Head one block up 23rd to M & C (aka Thanasi's) Market for some of the cheapest liquor prices I've ever seen outside of BevMo and Coscto (they actually beat BevMo and Costco on some items!).
author: Aaron V.

description:
Hey everybody- the emperor is wearing no clothes!  Jeez- just because Anthony B eats something on tv and the mindless masses flock to do the same does NOT mean that there should be no other viewpoint on this sandwich.

I thought it was disgusting.  Ever since I lost track of the amazing torta served at a taco truck on Fruitvale/International Blvd, I have been searching for my new place.  Maybe the bar was set too high, but the torta of my dreams comes on a fluffy bun, warmed- not toasted- and piled high with good quality carnitas or other grilled meat, cheese, avocado, jalepenos, mayo and hot sauce.

I knew I was in trouble when I sat down at the counter and placed my order.  The woman at the grill reached into the fridge and pulled out a container full of giant grey unrecognizably shaped meat.  She slapped it on the grill with a shit load of lo melt and at that point I had lost my appetite.  The bread to filling ratio of this sandwich was way off as well, but I really couldn't get over how nasty that meat looked, and the feeling of chewing shoe leather. Grey?  

If you are down with the quantity over quality, this place has it.  I will keep looking.
author: Kirsten H.

description:
Okay I doubt anyone here is looking for a review of the market, so here's the rundown for the sandwich counter: 

The Torta Cubana: 4 layers of meat were in this bad boy sandwich that was literally as big as my head.  And I have a huge head.  Layer 1: Milanesa (breaded steak), Layer 2: sausage (hot dogs?) sliced lengthwise, Layer 3: grilled jamon, Layer 4: chorizo y huevos.  Maybe Layer 4 should count as 2 layers since it's two different animals, but the take home message here is this sandwich is bonkers.  Each individual layer is made fresh, right in front of you, and the fresh bread I think is baked in the back of the market.  Top it off with queso fresco, some lettuce and tomato, and fresh crema and BOOM you got breakfast, lunch, and dinner for the entire day.  

4 stars for the incredible torta, plus 1 more star for the super nice lady making them behind the counter.  To know she cooked for Anthony Bourdain is pretty awesome.  

How does that guy stay so skinny?
author: William S.

description: I happen to be in San Francisco and wanted to try something greasy and artery clogging. One of my friends recommended the Torta Cubana at That's It Market. I enjoyed the whole huge sandwich. It had hot dogs, steak, chorizo, eggs, and avocadoes to name a few. It felt like it took around 15 minutes to cook but it was worth it. I love little street corner stores like this. If your getting over a hangover like myself and need something huge to satisfy your hunger. Come here and you will not regret it. Unless your watching your figure. I AM CRAVING ONE RIGHT NOW! only problem is that I am in Stockton! I will be back for you again!
author: Eric B.

description:
Wandered in here after a day at Dolores Park had me exhausted in hope's of just getting a couple beers for my buddy and I. 

Of course one of the first things I notice is the clanging of spatulas and this lil lady cookin up sandwiches half the size of her. I knew I'd better sit down and see what this was all about. I asked the neighborhood guys sittin across from me what they recommend and they easily replied the torta Cubana. 

I had no idea what I was in for until she started putting the sandwich together. I mean, I saw the ingredients being thrown on the griddle but had no idea that all of this stuff was going into one fuckin sandwich! How was I supposed to know that this thing was a monster of such epic proportions?!?

Either way I figured that I'd never be able to finish this monstrosity but after starting in on it I liked it so much that scarfed it in less than 10 minutes. Washing it down with a tall can as I went. 

After I was done I never took note of the liquor store with a griddle inside of it in the Mission, always kickin myself for not remembering where this magical place was. Was I imagining things?

About 6 months later I heard about Anthony Bourdain doing an episode of No Reservations and fuck me running they show the liquor store!! Turns out it's called That's-It Market. Big ups to Tony Bourdain and No Reservations for redirecting me to this spot. It won't be falling off my radar again.
author: Tommy P.

description: Come here if you're looking for the mother of all gut-bombs, the Torta Cubana. Plus they're open pretty late.
author: Ben M.

description:
EXCELLENT!

I have to thank Yelp for this one. I saw it in the email, sent it to a friend, and suddenly the urge for one of those Torta Cubanas took over. It was so good it made me feel bad.

Definitely worth a try, I spent about an hour in the mission waiting for the place to open up, I was determined to see what the raves were about. 

Chorizo, bacon, milanesa, on bread - watching the lady bake it in front of me was a teaser to the experience. 

Three thumbs up.
author: Roxy G.

description:
Torta Cubana....Bourdain wasn't lying one bit about this one.

Bring an appetite and some Tums.
author: Brent A.

description:
The Torta Cubana is some kind of amazing sandwich! I only allowed myself to buy this yummy torta-meat-love-fest with fixins-piled-high if I walked an hour to get it. After assuaging my guilt with a very long and brisk walk, I was not disappointed. That sandwich is pretty darn tasty.

For $10 you get a sandwich big enough for two people. If you're a sandwich lover this place will become your holy grail. The sandwich is cooked to order, which took at least 10 minutes, but worth the wait.

Make a trip from wherever you are to That's It Market at Mission and 23rd Street and sample a Torta Cubana.
author: Yvette K.

description:
Right after dinner, with a group of friends, we stumbled upon this place.  We remembered it from Anthony Bourdain's "No Reservation" SF episode.  We were all full, but couldn't resist to try the 7lb. Cuban Torta!  The lady behind the counter was nice and asked if we wanted her to cut up the sandwich so that we could share.  Honestly, the sandwich was so big it could have easily been a meal for 4 ppl!  

Needless to say, it was goood!  Even after just having dinner, I couldn't stop myself from eating the torta because it was so tasty!  After leaving, I felt so full and gross that I started doing thai boxing maneuvers and lunges to try to burn off those calories!  No joke!  I think it helped that I was walking around the Mission-- no one even did a second take!
author: Kitty L.

description:
The bottom line: Cheap, Huge, delicious sandwich. Nuff' Said!

I'll admit I didn't actually come here, which I've been waiting to do, but I was brought home 1/2 of a Torta Cubana. I was instantly in love, the thing has everything in the fridge on it. Its tasty, really unhealthy but I think something like 8 bucks? Forget what you have to say for the price its great. The only thing I could do without is the hot dog, its a really crappy quality hot dog, they shoulda just thrown in some ground beef!
author: Steven C.

description: The infamous Torta Cubana never disappoints. The legends true, indeed. That being said, their falafel sandwich is also good! Friendly staff, and the owner is cool. I will make sure to update once I make my way down their Mediterranean menu.
author: Eli G.

description:
I probably consumed about 1000 calories eating half of this sandwitch called Cuban Tortas.  It was one of the most illegal and unhealthiest foods I've ever had in my lifetime.  It was dangerous to my physical well-being.  I don't want to know how much transfat I've consumed and see the nutritional value of what I ate today.

This sandwich guarantees you a heart attack.  It had bacon, eggs, ham, beef mi lanesa, hog dogs, sour cream, mayo, cheese, avocado and jalapenos all wrapped up in this buttered bread.  I know it sounds gross and it may be, but it's super good.  I'm just grateful to be alive to write this review after this sandwich.
author: Jang David K.

description: This place was popularized by Anthony Bourdain, but has been around a long time. A sandwich counter in a liquor store. What a novel idea! One of the biggest Cubanas I have ever seen or eaten! A Cubana will set you back $10 bux but it is enough for more than one meal. Meat, Hot Dogs, Egg and more. Sandwich is for the big appetite for sure! Use the $2 Coupon from Yelp to save some bux.
author: Les W.

description:
I just couldn't believe how all that stuff could fit into one sandwich.
It's definitely a Jenga game between the torta cubana and your mouth but wow, so much flavor! It was actually less greasy than we thought...
Not sure it's a gourmet choice but definitely very good eats.
She was making tortillas too while we were digging the cuban monster, definitely a plus.
author: Dario B.

description:
OMG!!!  This sandwich was awesome!!! I saw this place on No Reservations and decided this was a must have.  I was not sure what to order so I asked the lady to give me what the dude on TV ordered.  She started frying up all sorts of meats :
  Beef Milanesa (Breaded Steak)
  Hot Dog/Sausage
  Chorizo 
  Ham 
  Bacon
Then they added some egg to the mix, cheese, sour cream, mayo, peppers etc etc.. and put it on the torta bread.  I ate the whole thing and I'm pretty sure it took years of my life.  No regrets now, however when I'm clutching my chest in pain, my opinion will probably change!
Parking was a definitely a pain.
author: Sach Bob C.

description:
My friend and i were both hungover and was looking for some grub.  We planned on going to a taqueria on 24th and valencia... but when we were driving by Thats It market he mentioned it was on Anthony Bourdain's no reservation.  So I coerced him into coming here instead of going to the taqueria!

When you walk in.. the smell is so delightful!  We sat down and ordered the Torta Cubana.  We said everything on it with all the fixings!  We sat at the counter infront where we can watch the lady cook our stuff!  The torta consisted of a large thinly sliced beef steak, hot dogs, deli ham, bacon, tons of chorizo and eggs, sour cream, mayo, cheese, jalapeno, tomatoes, avocado.. i feel like im still missing a few more items.. oh yea.. BIG SLOBS OF BUTTER.. that makes it mighty tasty!  

My friend and i each ordered one for ourselves... but i immediately regreted that idea... definitely could have shared one.  I ate 3/4 of the sandwich.. and my friend was close behind.  I would have taken the rest to go... but with all the fixins i dont think it would have been good to eat later... like the bread would probably go sowgie .. etc.. for $10 this sandwich is hella.. yes hella! lol cheap!

I think this is one of the best sandwiches ive had.. well because it has every.. well almost every possible thing that i love combined into ONE  sandwich!
author: Jasen L.

description:
First off...I can't believe I didn't use the $2 off Yelp coupon on my Torta! 
Yet another reason to return for my second Torta Cubano. 

The fact that you're eating in a liquor store is crazy enough, but once you bite into the sandwich, you're immediately taken to the land of..."damn that's a good sandwich" and forget about your surroundings. It's filled with lots of meats (at least 3 or 4), eggs, jalapenos, cheese, lettuce, tomato, and surrounded by a grilled soft bun. It's $10, but definitely enough to feed two or one hungry yelper. 

Yes, it's on the greasy/unhealthy side, but so are fried Twinkies and I can't imagine those tasting better.  Don't eat it everyday and workout a couple times a week so you don't have to worry about it.

Even my wife, who's a "selective" eater really enjoyed the cubano.   We'll definitely be back again!
author: Neil W.

description: Biggest and best Torta Cubana ever. Absolutely delicious. Must have if you're a meat lover! I used to eat one (could barely finish it) several times a week when I lived closer to it.
author: Abhishek S.

description:
Straight up: 

The Steak Cubana Torta is the greatest sandwich I've ever tasted.  I'm not just saying it just to say but I truly believe that the torta i devoured in that small liquor store was heaven in between two slices of crusty on the outside, downy soft on the inside juices soaking bread.

I came here with the homies Otis B. and Jay V.  and first thing I heard was Al-Jazeera on a TV perched above the entrance.  On one side was a counter to purchase stuff and the other side was what I like to call The Promised Land - a small kitchen space with a smiling lady who's cooking the most perfect sandwich out of what looked like a 2 burner stove.  I could already see all the meats piled up on the stove: chorizo mixed with eggs, quartered hot dogs, juicy slices of carne asada, slabs of honey hamon, strips of smoked bacon.  they combine that with avocado, tomato, and other stuff to create the BEST SANDWICH EVER.

Thank you Tony Bourdain for the $2 off coupon we yelpers get because of your visit.
author: Ray R.

description:
4 stars because they deliver to my favorite bar (MISSION BAR, yeeee).  
Ok so ya, the Cubana is a beast.  I'm not sure if I would really call it "great", "delicious", or "tasty".  
It's a freak show between two buns.
At one point, I used to be 100 pounds heavier than I am now.  I'm guessing it had to do with the fact that between 2006-2008, I would get one of these sandwiches at least twice a week.
Ya.  Think about that.
author: Meh M.

description:
the freaking Cuban is sooooo freaking good.. once i saw Milanesa Chicken, hot dog, chorizo with Eggs, I was in freaking heaven.

You gotta eat is with a plate.. don't eat while driving, unless you want to get your dress shirt dirtied with Avocado and Chorizo.

I was driving to pick up my Brother-in-law from SFO.  I'm dying for food and I love Milanesa Tortas.  I got their Milanesa Torta, which was delish, and I wanted to try out their Torta Cubana and I think I got a chirozo for him.

Well i can't wait to dig in, but I'm driving.  I tried to layer the torta with the cheezy napkins, but it was failed effort, that didn't work.. my dress shirt was pretty much soiled in chorizo and Avocado.

buy that shiet was soo freaking good!

- 1 star for the cheezy napkins.  This place is the 2nd best torta I've ever had.  that's the only reason why it's 4 stars in my book.
author: patrick p.

description:
Hot damn. The Cubana Torta is SO FREAKING GOOD. It really is a heart attack waiting to happen, but its so incredibly worth it. Too bad I didn't see this yelp page first - could've saved $2!!! dangit.

This torta is absolutely huge, and its made with everything fatty in the world, cooked on the stove with butter. Bacon, ham, fried steak, chorizo with egg, avocados, hot dogs...I don't know what else was thrown in there. But I do know that it was delicious. I ate half a torta. For $10, you get the giant torta AND a plate of healthy salad!
author: Carol L.

description: Only thing I've had is the torta cubana and its great! Cheap for the price and way more than you need.  I ate the whole thing the first time to see if I could and, though I could, it was overwhelming.  I had to sit down and ride out the food coma for a while.  Not that if wasn't worth it.  I'd say, on a normal day, to split it or save the other half for later.  Lots of meat and veggies on a good roll.  And delicious hot sauce.  Can't go wrong.  Also, Anthony Bourdain came here so it's a fun novelty to check out.
author: Jack M.

description:
The market was very easy to find especially with the bright green sign. The cubano sandwiches that my friends and i ordered were amazing. The cubano was a work or art; i fine balance of the entire livestock: pork, beef, and chicken(in form of eggs). The menu was short but you know that whatever is on the menu is amazing because the cook solely specialize on those few items. The wait was not bad at all considering there was only one person taking orders and cooking while at the same time extending a warm hospitality. 

If you're the type of person who enjoys a variety of seasoned and cured meats all sandwiched between soft pieces of bread the size of your head, then I highly recommend That's It Market.
author: Dat V.

description: Gotta have the Cuban -- the mother of all sandwiches.
author: Jane L.

description:
Ahhh...The cuban torta...the sandwich that Anthony Bourdain made famous! 

It is the worst sandwich I have ever had. I was so sick that I was tempted to induce vomit to get it out my system!! Even thinking about it now is making me sick!! 

Anthony,  I expected more from you!!
author: Reza E.

description: Have you ever had a hankering for a sandwich the size of your face? Well, wait no more, my friends! Whether or not you are a supporter of Anthony Bourdain, it's very unlikely that you have issues with ginormous, juicy tortas.
author: Lily T.

description:
My friend and I ventured here for the ENORMOUS TORTA CUBANA. I still vomit a little when I think about it. It's one of those things you try once and hope to live through. 

Being brave souls we got it with everything and split it, because no one human should eat that entire thing. Although while we were waiting for ours, there were definitely a few people sitting eating their own Torta Cubana. I would definitely come back here to share this experience with others, but next time I'll order some of the lighter Mediterranean fare the have. Everything looked absolutely delicious!

Go there just so you can say you survived the Torta Cubana as well. Definitely bragging rights.
author: Victoria A.

description:
Just tried this place the last time we were in the Mish...

DOOD....the torta cubana is freakin huge, heavy, salty, mayo-ey, and DELICIOUS. 

Personally, as another reviewer mentioned, this sando could probably do without the hot dogs, but the combination of all the meat, avocado, tomato, mayo and lettuce was pretty damn awesome. I might have to strap on an extra set of cajones to tackle an entire sandwich though...

We shared 2 torta cubanas between 4 guys total....we ate half each and i was pretty satiated. While i do believe i could finish an entire one in a sitting, i'm assuming it would make for a very bad day after that...seriously, this thing has gotta have AT LEAST 3k calories and small tubs worth of fat, but its delish and you must eat this if you are in the area and ready for something greezerific.
author: matt h.

description:
I have had better tortas - but nothing beats the Cubano. 
Whist it is nothing like a real Cuban sandwich,  who the frak cares because there is bacon and hotdog in it... mmm tube meat and bacony. 

I will be bringing my more adventurous eaters here and when I feel like going into a food coma.
author: Danyel R.

description:
it was SO big! I had to share with my friend. it was very very cheap for two (cheaper than a Mc Donald's) and I can tell you're not hungry after that! And the whole thing tasted real good too. 
Not recommended to vegetarians (for sure!) and to hygiene freaks: the trash is just next to the grill... But it was colourful, cheap and good.
author: Juiette R.

description: Yeah get the torta cubana. I've never seen so much greasy deliciousness in a pile. First ate here on a foodie adventure and now I happen to live nearby. I'd be lying if I said this place wasn't part of the reason I moved here ;)
author: Kevin G.

description:
GIANT TORTA

After watching Anthony Bourdain eat here on the television show "No Reservations", I knew I had to try this place.  We walked into the humid liquor store/restaurant and studied the menu.  There were some Middle Eastern sandwiches but the reason for stopping here was the giant Cuban torta.

Cuban Torta
The friendly cook threw a breaded steak on the grill then added bacon, sliced hot dog, and chorizo.  Scrambled eggs were then mixed with the chorizo and liberal amounts of butter or margarine was added to the grill.  She then placed the sliced torta bread on the grill.  The grilled bread was slathered with mayonnaise and filled with crumbled Mexican cheese, shredded lettuce, sliced tomatoes, and pickled jalapenos.  To complete the torta, she added the grilled steak, crisp bacon, hot dog, and scrambled eggs with chorizo.  We split this humongous sandwich; I don't know how anyone could eat an entire one.

Bring your appetite and a bottle of statins for this sandwich.
author: Rob L.

description:
What happened? 

I came here and ordered my favorite torta only to find they replaced the delicious chunks of avocado with cheap industrial guacamole squirted from a bag. Stuff gave me the green runs. 

Save that, everything else was fine but I REALLY hope they change back to real avocado. I'd even be willing to pay more.
author: Joe S.

description:
After seeing this previewed on Anthony Bourdain's "No Reservations," I had to give it a try. Naturally I ordered the "Cubana." It took about 7 minutes to make this thing, and it was a monster. It consists of the following:

- Beef Milanesa (Breaded Steak)
-  Hot Dog
- Chorizo 
- Ham 
- Egg
- Bacon
- Mexican Cheese
- Avocado/Jalapeno/Tomatoes
- Sour Cream and Mayonnaise

Surprisingly, it is not as greasy as you would think it might be. It is very filling, and is a great hangover meal without a doubt. It costs $10.00, but if you print out the Yelp coupon, you can get $2 off. The atmosphere is exactly like that of any liquor mart you would find on the corner of any San Francisco street. There are a few seats if you want to eat there. This might be a good idea if it is your 1st time, however, the sandwich keeps just fine if you want to bring it home with you. Definitely worth trying.
author: Michael C.

description:
Like most other recent reviewers of this fine establishment, I too was informed by Tony Bourdain's popular foodie culture show. I recently got around to actually trying this gargantuan sandwich of epic proportions, and holy smokes--this thing is unlike any sandwich you've ever seen before in your life! 

What DOESNT this sandwich have in it? Beef Milanesa, chorizo, ham steak, beef hot dog, fried egg, cheese, avocado, sour cream, inside of two humongous pieces of yummy bread. I'm getting full just thinking about it.

Definitely worth the trip! But be warned, the price of this piece of gastro-bomb heaven is $10 and is definitely enough for two people to share. Unless of course you're me... and you save the rest for breakfast the next day. :-D
author: Andrew C.

description:
This place should be called "That's a Big Sandwich Market" instead. 

My friend saw this place on an episode of Anthony Bourdains "No Reservations" and suggested I try the Cuban sandwich. I missed his SF episode so I wasn't sure what I was in for. When he explained that the place was actually a liquor store with a grill inside, I was a bit hesitant to try this place. But knowing that Anthony Bourdain has a great reputation for eating great food and I was already meeting friends a block away for Suiza's at El Farlito for lunch, I decided to stop by and give it a try. 

The grill is actually a small counter that sits roughly 6 people. The menu offers alot of options, but everyone at the time at the counter were all eating a sandwich. So I decided to order the Cuban sandwich and boy was I not disappointed. The menu states the Cuban has 5 different meats and egg, which to me is a match made in heaven. The sandwich is literally the size of a football and can feed 2 average guys or 8 petite Asian girls. 

If you're in the Mission and looking for a filling sandwich that is only $10, I would recommend checking out this place. Make sure you get extra napkins, you'll thank me later.
author: Sun-Kai P.

description:
Went out with a bunch of friends after trying to find some toy models and afterward when we were all hungry one of them says "Let's find that place that Anthony Bourdain reviewed." And so, the entire trip there, he kept raving about that review and how we'd all find out. 

We pull up and get parking right by the deli and yes, it's a deli (that was a surprise). We all grab seats and order up -- the majority of us going on the recommendation of Cuban Tortas (though someone else tried something else and it escapes me as to what they tried) and watched these things being made. OMgoodness, yes, that alone amazed me but then once we started eating -- so good. I was only able to finish half and handed the remainder to the one who didn't order the torta so he could try it later on. Yes, he loved it as did the rest of us. It's so worth it -- even the guilt that comes later. So much guilt that we dubbed it "death sandwich" but it's still so very much worth it.
author: Shauna S.

description:
Ok so I know alot of you guys came to this place only because you saw it on Anthony Bourdain and strictly to get the Cubana, and that's fine. But in
Doing so you are missing out on the other Tortas which are much better. The chicken milanesa torta is awesome
And full of flavor. I highly recommend it. The Cubana is definitely an experience though, more of a spectacle than
Anything. It lacks any real flavor, more like a big jumbled mess. But glad to see that the appearance on the show has helped business!
author: Nick R.

description: I can't believe I've walked by the place a million times thinking it was just a liquor store.  I thought $8 (with the yelp discount too!) was expensive.  Then I saw the size of the sandwich!
author: Jason B.

description:
Yes...I was one of the many people that only came because of it being on No Reservations.  But what I got was a pleasant surprise.

Yes I did get the infamous Cubana.  Yes I had to pick up my jaw off the ground multiple times due to the snowballing awe and loathing gradually building up within me while it was being prepared.  Yes I was shocked that it was bigger than my head.  Yes I finished it myself, in one sitting...and yes, I rolled out (literally) afterwards.

Artery-clogging?  Why, yes it is.  Gourmet?  Might be to someone but I'd call it above average more than anything.  I left feeling both content and in a fit of self-hatred only because it was a glutton moment.
author: Joshua G.

description:
Holy fat face!  Creating this Cuban Torta was one of the most amazing cooking displays I've ever seen.  Massive slabs of breaded beef, thick slices of ham, hot dogs, and huge scoops of chorizo bubbling in their own individual juices.  And what delicious amazing delicious juices they are!  Top that with some queso fresca, fresh avocado, and jalapenos all in between 2 massive slabs of generously buttered bread.  

It's all constructed right on front of you on an open grill, and it puts the gut in GUTBOMB!  It's friggin amazing, and probably best split between 2 friends.  You'll hate yourself for the rest of the day, but I truly believe this is a landmark for the mission. 

If you want a super tasty super dirty everything mexican under one bun, get here.  It beats the best torta you'll find.
author: Jon S.

description:
Alright so everyone nowadays thinks that they;re a foodie, ME included.

So of course I have to try this crazy ass cuban torta sandwich because...WELL IM A FOODIE right,

Well foodie or not this is a damn good sandwich, especially if you like your meat in all shapes and flavors.  The sandwich consists of breaded beef cutlet, two julianned hotdogs, a deli slice of ham, a chorizo cheese omelette, and of course, bacon.  The bread is smothered in mayonnaise, lettuce, tomatoes, sour cream, some crumbly cheese, and jalpenos.  

I recommend sharing this unless you are really hungry or really drunk.    The staff in the mart are friendly and provide a great service.  This is a must go!
author: Richard N.

description: The Cubana is good, it's huge. Seriously, it's huge. I wish the bread was different, it was kinda tasteless and not very appetizing bread. It doesn't take away from the sandwich though because the contents of the sandwich are about 4x the height of the bread.
author: Rohan D.

description:
NO RESERVATIONS' star Anthony Bourdain featured the Tortas here. I will come back to try a cubano.

However as for the liquor store I feel like it's fairly overpriced.
author: Anthony K.

description: A mission district staple featured on No Reservations. do yourself a favor folks. hop the bart after the victory parade and take the one block walk  north for the Cubana Ultimo sandwich. you'll be glad you did.
author: M R.

description:
Okay.  This review is, like so many others, centered on the Torta Cubana.  So maybe I'm one of the last fat-asses in the city to try the notorious Mexican staple from That's It Market, a commmmmbination liquor store and deli serving tortas, tacos, tostadas and, inexplicably, falafels, but I don't care. Because I will tell you the truth about this mystical Torta Cubana: IT'S NOT AS BIG AS EVERYONE SAYS.

Let me quickly qualify that statement. The Torta Cubana is objectively big. For a normal person, it's a large sandwich in both girth and height, comprised of strategic layers of breaded beef, ham, chorizo, hot dogs (YES, hot dogs), bacon, jalapenos, lettuce, tomatoes, cheese, guacamole and mayo on a huge, almost painfully soft piece of bread and is probably too much to finish in one sitting. But for someone who a) has been drinking at The Monk's Kettle prior to eating dinner, then polishes off two Sparks (caffeine-free, BOO), or b) gets morbidly excited over such heart-cloggers as carne asada fries, this sandwich is gonna be the perfect size.

Much of the Torta Cubana's popularity is due to its recent feature on "Anthony Bourdain: No Reservations," the Travel Channel show where Tony goes around to different cities trying different food, making snarky remarks, and keeping me really pondering the answer to the question, "Would I hook up with that?" But I am into the idea of the Torta Cubana because for what you get, it's pretty cheap. I'm talking $10 for a sandwich you can't even fit your mouth around. But since most of you are gonna share this baby, that's like $5 each for a good, honest meal -- definitely puts the footlong from Subway to shame.

Now, a note about taste. Like most food that looks gross, it's somewhere in between "Oh-my-God-now-I-can-die-happy" and "Oh-my-God-what-did-I-just-stick-in-my-mouth." Which is to say it tastes exactly how it looks: okay. And to that, I say God bless America.

On another note, my friend swears by the carne asada tacos here.  Apparently they're really inexpensive and girthy.  Next time.
author: Christy J.

description:
Like many people here, I had no intention of eating here till I saw it on No Reservation.

And like most of you I tried the Cubana. My advice is DONT EAT IT ALONE. Like a fool, I attempted, and reluctantly, succeeded in eating the whole thing. The first half was tasty, not great, but tasty enough.

The second half was pure hell. The saltiness and texture of all that meat made me feel sick! It got to the point that with every bite I felt like I could throw up. I think I almost died eating that sand which.

So yes, the Cubana is good if you eat a decent portion of it. Eat too much and the flavor becomes disgusting.
author: David D.

description: I've only tried the Torta Cubana, but that's enough for me to give this place a 4. This thing is freaking HUGE! I bought one for my coworker and myself, and let me tell you, even half of this thing is more than filling. And while you wait for your sandwich, you can grab a tall-boy, buy a box of condoms, or flip through the porno rack. The sandwich is not only huge, but the taste is AWESOME! Especially the Milanesa.
author: Ron Z.

description: The Torta Cubana is gigantic, greasy, delicious, and everything you should ever expect out of a massive Cubana sando.  It's worth the wait, and the ambiance is exactly what you need to eat this amazing concoction.  Bring an empty stomach or a friend, but you don't need your wallet.  A couple of "once overs" through your couch for loose change ought to get you to $8 pretty quickly.
author: Nick T.

description:
more isn't always better, but it works here

Cubana Torta:
huuuuuge. delish. cheap.

can easily be used for two meals.   what more do you want?
author: Arthur T.

description: Had the weirdest and biggest torta ever.  It was delicious but I would probably not have the hot dogs in there myself.  There was really nothing much as far as atmosphere here as it was a liquor store as well.
author: Amy S.

description:
The Center Of The Mile, the sign says. The mile between Potrero and, I dunno...Church Street? Between Division and Army, who can tell??? No one knows. I'm better aware of the fact that this is also the unofficial Home Of The Nine Dollar Six-Pack.

Random thoughts on That's It - The Center Of The Mile
[SF/X: The Clash - The Magnificent Dance]

~ When the guys here watch Al-Jazeera, it's usually tuned to a soap opera or a black & white movie, not a speech by a really beardy guy who I'm pretty sure thinks I'm going to hell. That's kind of nice. ~ Much of this candy here seems to predate the Ford Administration. What the hell is a Zagnut? Beware. ~ I like the $2 Out The Door stickers on 40 oz's here. Why can't they be on everything, everywhere? ~ Also beware of Mexican porn, particularly the black & white kind. It's usually just bad photocopies of awful early 90s porn. And the ink smudges like crazy. Or so I'm told. ~ Can't recommend the comics sold here enough. They're small in size and though I don't read much Spanish, from what I can tell they're all about a gigantic mustache who goes around shooting everyone. Sometimes the moustache has a cowboy hat and wrestles with a blonde lady. Awesome! ~

Not my favorite liquor store, but they're open late and this is a tough corner to work I'd imagine. Even though I don't care for the tortas here, I suppose at least they're here, unusually for a liquor store. And there is something a little wicked about buying an It's It from That's It.

Anyhow, I am quietly kicking ass here on all the neighborhood liquor store reviews. M & C Discount Center, get a head start because I'm coming for you. Hard!
author: Jeremy W.

description:
Kind of Over priced, but they keep good hours & they have Champagne.

That & Nat Sherman Natural cigarettes with Mint in the Tip.

Wow, I sound like a bourgeois asshole.
author: Rebekah K.

description:
There are a few places in your lifetime that you need to publicize like an epic battle - the Cuban Torta is one of them. My friend was quickly punk-checked by the clerk when he uttered the words "sandwich", as she quickly responded "TORTA!!" Yes.. this is SPARTA and you too will feel like you got kicked in the chest as you stare at this 5lb monster.  My friends and I felt so bad after consuming this beast that we walked over an hour to walk it off. 

By the way, thanks for letting us not drink any beers last weekend in your establishment as it was the only hour I was completely sober.
author: David N.

description: Oh the cuban. I love the cuban. I crave the cuban. The cuban is a heart attack on a plate. I should stay away from the cuban. But I love the cuban.
author: soy w.

description: Tried this place because Anthony Bourdain was here. Watched the "chef" cook our torta cubana and it made the torta taste a little worse. I do not recommend watching the chef cook your food you are about to eat. I would much rather order and receive it and have the mystery of not knowing exactly how it was cooked.  Definitely had to share the sandwich. Warning: you will smell like grease if you dine in.
author: Bee Y.

description:
I don't think I 've ever purchased anything from this store but I am utterly fascinated by the name. 

That's It.  The Center of the Mile.

Anybody know what that's from?  Anyway, I did a big time-elapse photo shoot of it from across the street and maybe one day I'll post them. That's It!
author: Sweet T.

description:
I swear the Cubana sandwich was as big as my head! 

I don't even want to know the amount of fat or calories in this wonderous creation. It's made on a tiny grill within the market and fascinating to watch. When the whole thing begins with butter you know it's gonna be good. 

I was aware that my sandwich contained beef, bacon & pork, but when the chorizo and egg hit the grill I thought it was for someone else. Add avocado, tomato, lettuce, jalapeno, queso fresca, mayo....
Forgive me arteries. I had to do it.
author: Bada B.

description:
Seriously, that No Reservations episode is fact.  Everything good and bad at the same time is thrown on this thing.  I've had cubana tortas from a certain place in Redwood City and they just don't compare to what you get here.  You know it's good when you see all the wine bottles covered in plastic wrap because there is so much grease coming from the stove.  Thats my type of joint.   The cubana is way too much food for a normal person, or just enough for a serious eater.  Yep, it weighs a few pounds and cost $10!  Oh, they apparently serve other stuff too which I need to check out.  

If there is anything to note, parking sucks and coming here at night may not be comforting for most people (not used to the Mission).
author: Simon Y.

description: This place has a pretty good torta cubana. The food is made right there and in GIANT portions. It's def heart attack, artery clogging overload. Good place for late night munchies, but I have had the tortas while sober and it seems they put soo much shit on em to mask that they are just sub-par. I'd def rec people try it out, but def not an everyday type of meal.
author: Mr. Potato G.

description: Whoa! Who would think that one of the best sandwiches out there was being made at corner grocery store in the mission!? Well, it is. Check this monster out, it features hot dog, chorizo, bacon, milanesa, ham, avocado...more things than I can remember. Big on flavor (cholesterol, fat and calories I'm sure as well) small on price. They have a counter with three or four stools for sitting and two small tables that each seat two. I'm a fan of Little Lucca's in SSF. This torta rivals their hearty sandwiches in size and flavor, but is a quietly kept secret apparently since we were able to walk in and enjoy it in under 10 minutes (not counting parking). By contrast we drove by Little Lucca's prior to coming here and it looked like at least a 30 minute wait there. Try it and then go for a long walk to work it off :)
author: Jose U.

description:
Freakin humongous, carnivorous sammich called the torta cubano
They should call it the heart attack central. Couldn't even finish the whole thing, only ate half of it. It was delicious but extremely greasy and probably worth 1000000 calories. Not something you would want to eat everyday, if you did your lifespan would probably  decrease by half.

You should totally give this place a try but beware you may feel sleepy and 20 pounds heavier after eating it.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
Go. Eat the Cuban. Bring a friend. 

Hint - Get it to go and take it to the Napper Tandy around the corner, grab a booth and a beer to go with this meat orgy.
author: Kemp M.

description:
Adding another star because for the milanesa de res, this place cooks a raw piece of milanesa to order (as opposed to simply reheating an already cooked milanesa).  Not many places do this, sadly.

Now if they would only switch up the bread, a little too soft to handle all that sloppy torta goodness.
author: David C.

description: Torta cubana: First bite was decadence. Bring 3 friends or a compost bucket.
author: James P.

description: Big F'ing Sandwich.  Tried many in LA and Texas and this is one of the best tortas I've eaten
author: Art W.

description:
The grill opens at 11 a.m., and, while it's in a liquor store, I don't know if you can booze at the lunch counter. My friend and I got sodas, so I didn't ask.

We got the Torta Cubana. WOW - everything that's good and right and proper about yummy dive chow is here. Greasy? Only a little. Chock full of meaty, salty goodness? Oh HECK yea!!  

If you go expecting any ambiance beyond that of a 24th -n- Mission St. liquor store - you'll be sorely disappointed. If you want what God eats when he has a hangover - it's the place for you.

Got me to thinkin' (oh shnaps!!):  What makes a dive good?

That's It is a DIVE, but the food is SO good, it overcomes the location and the creepy guys checkin' out porn on the magazine rack. 

Go to Red's Java House, and it's a different combination of factors that make it good: It's divey, the food's just good, but the location under the Bay Bridge is fantastic.

Anyone remember Sam Wu's? Small, cramped, nothing good about the location, food good, but Edsel (RIP) the Cleaver-Wielding cook made it all worth while.

So, when does location or quirkiness overcome an average meal to make a dive really worthwhile? Or is it only about the food?

Hmmmmmm???
author: Paul G.

description:
After seeing this beast of a torta on Anthony Bourdain's "No Reservations," I had to try the Cubana.  It has the following: breaded steak, chorizo, hot dog, bacon, ham, egg, cheese, sour cream, mayo, avocado, jalapenos, and tomatoes.  This is pretty much what I would think is every breakfast item on the menu stuffed in a sandwich which pretty much makes this the greatest hangover food of all time.  And while it's surprisingly not greasy, this torta has a billion calories, so be sure to walk the hills of San Francisco after you finish eating it.. if you can eat the entire thing.

So it's easy to find being that it's a corner liquor market.  It's like any deli market except it has a cooking station.  The lady who made my Cubana looked like she really enjoys making them, especially when it's obvious I only heard of it through the TV show.  You can also get bottled sugary Coke here.

The Cubana is excellent though next time I'm going to ask for more jalapenos.  You can eat at the counter there, but if you plan on eating there, go when it's warm since the doors are wide open.  Highly recommend.

seems to have a high turnover of sandwich ingredients to stay fresh
service is ok, takes 5 minutes to make a sandwich
parking - can get lucky finding an open spot, metered
author: John D.

description: Try the tortas cubana today before i left sfWow the best tortas i every try tortas cubana it has every meat u can think of fried beef ham hotdog bacon butter mayo egg chorizo avocado lettuce tomato all on a  butter toasted bun what eles can u ask for world best sandwish finish the whole tortas cubana thanks Anthony no reservations for introdusting the best sandwish i every ate
author: sushiatown s.

description:
This review is for the Torta de Cubano.
Who would have thought this place would have such a great torta.
They pretty much throw everything into it and I have to say it is one serious sandwich.
Eating half would be enough for the normal person for this $10 mound of breaded slab of thin meat, egg, hot dog, Avocado, mayo, and Jalapeno.
