I know I am probably missing something else, but you can see the amount of items involved in the eating mission.  The red sauce has a slight heat and I recommend drizzling or drenching your sandwich in it.

Thumbs up (covered with sauce from the sandwich)
author: Po L.

description: After watching Anthony Bourdain: No reservations SF episode me and my boy immediately drove to the city to try this joint out. Maaan...did it live up to expectations! The cubana sandwich was amazing but it is HUGE..so come with a HUGE appetite or plan on splitting it with a buddy over a few cold ones. Nice little gem in the city.
author: Gustavo C.

description: Summoned to the Mission on a scenic Sunday I suggested it would be a great opportunity to try the World's Biggest Torta de Cubano.  While Realtor Betty was helping with a friend's recently opened pizza place, I wasn't in a pizza mood so we met up at That's It and that was it.   Realtor Betty skillfully put that bad boy away doing it layer by layer while I struggled to pick it up and eat it like a sandwich.  Eventually I came around to the layer by layer approach ... I almost went the 25th Street burrito route but I have really been on a mission to eat that Bourdain famed sandwich so mission on mission accomplished.  Yes, it's something all Yelpers must try once in their lives and then live to tell about it.
author: Terry A.

description: Lucha libre fan magazines, smut, liquor and... shwarma.  Kind of an interesting mix for a cornerstore.  Food was ok... very fried and not very healthy.
author: Danny C.

description: I've had tortas at many places but this is by far the best one I've had. The food is great, filling, and very friendly employees
author: Angel G.

description: Thanks to the allure of the yelp coupon, I tried the torta cubana and it's ok. Too meaty and a bit pricey for me. Of its many components, I liked the fresh egg (no scrambled egg substitutes here) and the chorizo (spicy yum). And the size may be worth the price tag: I ate half, A ate half and we were both really full.  Since they weren't busy at 11am on a Saturday, I sat down and watched the lady make it. I'm impressed, that space is tiny but she makes it work. She was really friendly and tailors the sandwich to you (jalapeno? mayo? etc). It was also how I saw the egg is freshly cracked. In SHORT, if you're really into meat, come here for a huge meaty sandwich and a friendly face.
author: Yan E.

description:
Fanfrickentastic the samich did not let me down I came I saw I ate the whole damn thing of course I am talking about the cuban torta nothing but grease slathered lovleyness thank you again Thats It market I will be back again 

P.S. do not eat Breakfast just be prepare to digest and nap as they do not sevre food till 12pm and then siesta time
author: J H.

description: bomb sandwich loaded with meaty goodness. freshly made on a little grill. kick back and enjoy a torta. I must try everything on the menu. its decently priced too.
author: Jake C.

description: The Cubano sandwiches are ginormous!  If you get one, it's the only thing you'll be able to eat all day (and probably not in one sitting).  The $2 off coupon on Yelp is a nice touch too!
author: Reuben S.

description: If you want something a little lighter but just as good, get the Milanese sandwich. The tortas can be a little overwhelming but worth a try at least once.
author: Gustaf A.

description: Happened to be working down in the mission and remembered seeing this place on No Reservations.  I went with the Cuban Torta.......you better be a carnivore for this one. Pretty much every type of meat plus eggs on a sandwich as big as a baby.  Very casual considering it's in a corner store.  I would definitely recommend checking it out at  if you find yourself in the area. Good people making good food, what else could you ask for.
author: Mark A.

description: Ok, I like a nice juicy torta as much as the next guy, but that's just gross.
author: Igor K.

description: After finding out about this place on Anthony Bourdain's "No reservation" show on the Travel channel, I had to check it out for myself. The Torta sandwiches are what they are known for, and believe me it wasn't a disappointment. That Sandwich of course is not for the faint heart. It is the biggest thing I've ever seen, and they just about stuff everything in it but the kitchen sink. It is totally a fun experience if you happen to be in the Mission. I've made a point to take almost all my friends that visit from the east coast or even from overseas. The prices are very reasonable, I would say even cheap, and it's definitely something to talk about.
author: Kabra M.

description: Man o Man; the Torta Cubana is amazing. Probably one of the best sandwiches I've ever had. This simple little Liquor store in the Mission serves up some incredibly tasty food. You walk in, Belly up to the counter, and order an extremely savory Torta sandwich. Their Cubana is literally bigger than my head. While your waiting, you can grab a beverage from the fridges behind you. Definitely a simple but, memorable experience.
author: Marco M.

description:
something strange about having a meal served to you at a liquor store. 

forget Anthony Bourdain and just get a "Carne Torta". The Lady that is doing the cooking in the daytime is super nice. but the real show is the guy at night. dude is decked out in a suit looking like he should be in a las vegas lounge show it's great!

great hangover spot too. i am not mad at this place. 

the Tortas are huge! my girfriend and i shared one and were stuffed. and yes my girlfriend is daring enough and cool enough to go and have dinner with me at a liquor store and that's one of the many reasons why i love her!
author: Calama T.

description:
There comes a time, in many relationships, when things escalate to a place where no one really wanted to see them go.  And when that happens, you need to take a step back, take some deep breaths, and allow reason and logic back into the equation.  We've all been there.

For example, remember the time when you and your buddies were out cruising around in your Jeep Wrangler, listening to tunes and shooting the breeze, and then the driver suggested going to a party at the house of some guy you didn't know?  Sounded a bit odd, but you all went along with it.  Then, when the host of the party wouldn't let you in, you tried to bum rush the door, and got denied?  Again, this is beyond what you were expecting, but still within the realm of reason.  Then, the three of you went back to the Jeep, and the driver started pulling out baseball bats and tire irons so you could fight your way in the door?  You were still kinda cool with that idea, but things had definitely taken a strange turn.  But then, the driver pulled out a can of gasoline and proceeded to slosh it on the wall of the house, so he could set it on fire and smoke the party-goers out?  If you remember these things, then you are either Paul Anthony, B-Fine, or Bowlegged Lou, and I really appreciated your performance in the movie House Party.  I am honored you read my reviews.  And I know you get what I'm saying: sometimes things just escalate beyond control, and you need to rein it back in before the cops take you down to the docks and beat you up.

Same thing with the sandwiches here.  There was a time, some time ago, when the average size of the Cubano started topping 2 pounds, and that was the time when someone should have said "do we REALLY need a sandwich that weighs more than any of the Gossling children?"  Every Cubano sandwich here should come with two sides: 8 more slices of bread, and a friend to help you eat the thing.

The practical-joke size of the sandwich aside, it's actually quite good.  I recommend it the next time your soccer team needs to split a sandwich.
author: Ben P.

description: I don't know where they get the meat, but get one of those Cubana Tortas, i promise u u wont even care!
author: Desmond D.

description: One of the best sandwiches I've ever had. I split it with my buddy and we were stuffed for 10 bucks!! It may not be the most healthy, but its a killer sandwich.
author: Jonah G.

description: I got the Cuban Torta for $10. It was huge and messy to eat, but very tasty. I couldn't finish my 1st half of the sandwich and had to take it to go along with my 2nd half. I also made the lady cook blush when I asked her if she made the torta for Anthony Bourdain and she said that she did and that he ate the whole thing himself.
author: Andi L.

description:
o god
i ate the whole thing.

so delicious.
author: Simon C.

description: The torta cubana is a must try! At $10 it's a bit steep & worth the wait.
author: M R.

description:
My friend Jung invited me out here recently for tortas after having seen That's It featured on Anthony Bourdain's No Reservations. I had noticed That's It and it's odd name, but had no idea they served food. A woman named Alicia rents a grill in the corner of the store, with a counter that seats 5 or 6. You order at the counter, pay at the register. That's It also has an assortment of pre-made middle-eastern food, as well as several aisles devoted to booze and porn. Sadly, you aren't allowed to drink beer at the counter. I'm didn't ask if you're allowed to read porn at the counter.  In any case, my review pertains only to Alicia's food.
 
I didn't quite know what I was getting myself into, but I followed Jung's lead and ordered the cubana- a beast of a sandwich stacked with beef milanesa, egg scrambled with chorizo, ham, bacon, and sliced hot dog, and finished with queso blanco, avocado, jalapenos, sour cream, and mayonnaise, for $10. Kind of a stunt sandwich but it tasted, and held its shape, much better than I would have thought. Everything is grilled to order, and it is quite a show watching the cubana take shape. The lightly breaded beef was my favorite component, and the chorizo and japaleno gave the torta  a lot of smoky flavor. Frankly, the hot dog, ham, and bacon were a bit unnecessary. The bacon was also a little undercooked for my taste, not crispy but kind of flaccid and chewy. The cubana is  easily enough food for two people- I saved half of mine and had a good-sized lunch the next day. Probably not something I would order again but I would definitely go back to That's It . Alicia was a very cheerful, welcoming hostess, and clearly appreciates the attention and business that Bourdain's endorsement has brought her. It was a pleasure to watch her work and chit-chat with her, and I look forward to exploring the rest of her menu, which features tostadas and quesadillas.
author: Brian H.

description: Got food poisoning from eating their torta. Been throwing up a lot today. Can't say I'm super surprised; to sell a sandwich with that much meat in it for $8, you gotta be using some pretty low-quality ingredients.
author: Mark A.

description:
I visited this deli/ liquor mart after reading about them as a featured business on Yelp- glad I did.
Not knowing exactly what to expect, I ordered 2 Cabana's, 1 for me and 1 for my husband. They were the biggest sandwiches I've ever seen- holly shit!! They reminded me of a "hot" better version of the poor boy sandwich I use to order back in the day. 
There was a little bit of a language barrier at first- needed one sandwich with specific ingredients because of allergies but low and behold, the woman behind the counter got everything right- I love when that happens; nothing worse than bringing your food home and not being able to eat it.
I  think the sandwich had practically ever kind of meat there is and all cooked fresh right in front of you. It was a nice surprise to have avocado included, and not an extra. 
Side notes: this sandwich is not for those on a diet or picky eaters- for those of you who don't mind the calories and can appreciate the home cooked flavor, try this place out!
author: Julie Z.

description:
Now this is what I'm talking about... A hole in the wall market with excellent torta sandwiches! I first heard about this on Anthony Bourdain's show and decided that I had to give it a try. I ordered the Torta Cubana. It was totally worth the hype! I was only able to eat half of it because it's such a big sandwich. It's so tasty and full of meat. It's also pretty cheap for the size, it could definitely be good for 2 people.

I'm giving this place 5 stars just for their Torta Cubana so don't base this on the other food they have.
author: Arsenio M.

description: A fatboys dream. Had the "Mexican" Cuban. It had every food group and every animal species. The best.
author: JR. A.

description:
I recently moved, but lived a couple doors down for the last four years. I was actually pulling away from my parking space out front when Anthony B. and crew were in the place. 

A little about the place:

It is actually run as three different entities

1. Cornerstore run by Ali and Hassan. Nice guys.
2. Griddle, fryer, bar top with 5 chairs run by Alicia our favorite Mexican mother. So nice. Food's delicious. 12pm-9pm
3. Middle-eastern food after 9 pm from the same corner of the store that Alicia works out of from Sammie. 

"No Reservations" dined with Alicia. I am an avid follower of the show, and of Alicia. As I feel that her food is truly delicious (not what one would expect from the corner of the cornerstore) I was very excited to hear that she'd be on the episode. My only qualm is that they ordered the most ridiculous thing on the menu. I'm sure it was good, but the Cubana (everything on one sandwich) is a bit of a novelty - especially with the hot dog included. I was hoping they would try some other options as well. The tortas are fantastic - crumbly bread, crema, avocado and all. I recommend the chicken milanese - breaded chicken cutlet. The tacos are baja-style, small, crispy and delicious, with meat onions cilantro, salsa. The quesadillas are TO-DIE-FOR. The tortillas are made to order, rolled and pressed in front of you. You can order them "a la plancha" (on the griddle) or fried. The fried are my favorite, crunchy, textural, and full of flavor. "A la plancha" is good too, but fried is the way to go. The carne asada and pollo are my favs. I've heard good things about the zucchini flower/loroco too. You know it's a good sign when the guys from the taquerias come down to get food from her.

Congrats Alicia - You may need a bigger counter top soon.
author: Michael M.

description: Regardless whether this sandwich is regionally authentic, it was mighty tasty. I split the sandwich with a male friend and it was enough to fill us. I should inform you of its contents: cheap sandwich meat, hot dogs, 2 eggs, mystery ground meat patty, sandwich veggies, and LOTS of mayo. This sandwich is obnoxiously greasy and large and not for the faint of heart. Self proclaimed foodies will raise their chin in disgust but true adventurous eaters will happily devour this bestial thang.
author: Emily T.

description: If I'd known about the yelper discount I would have taken advantage of it. Didn't order the Cuban because the size was too big for one. Ordered the Milanguesa and was delighted. Great sandwich on a great torta bun. Friendly gal making the food. Highly recommend!
author: Jason B.

description:
regardless of what you saw on tv, only anthony bourdain gets to drink in here.  i ordered up the Cubano with some friends and went to buy a single beer only to be told that there's no drinking in the store like i saw on tv.  the guy at the register is really nice though and said something like, "Money is money, you know," and kinda shrugged his shoulders.  that's ok i totally get it.  went outside to drink my brown bag special with my friend only to find a bar next door.  haha! 

when i returned, my cubano was ready for me.  it's not quite as huge as everybody makes it out to be, and the proof is that my tiny 95-lb asian girlfriend chowed down a half by herself and was ready for more.  i actually couldn't believe how many layers of stuff they cram on there but at least i felt that i was getting my money's worth.  the cubano is a delicious sandwich and i'd definitely come back to order one to go.  it's really friendly in here but it's not the sandwich mecca i hoped it would be.
author: Holly B.

description: The world's biggest torta, for only $10.  Good deal, and it tastes pretty good. Big portions.
author: Basim Z.

description:
oh my YUM. thank you anthony bourdain. apparently the "No Reservations" episode was filmed 6+ months ago, but PR-induced inflation has yet to affect the sandwiches.  my sister and i got the vegetarian torta, meaning all ingredients sans meat plus egg.  LOTS of egg.  we opted for no sour cream (yuck) and light on the mayo.  $7 for a sandwich bigger than our heads. divide in half  = 2 happy ladies eating for $3.5 each.  breakfast, lunch, dinner. ANYTIME.

although...not sure how happy my arteries would be...
author: Dee C.

description: I use to always pass up this little corner market, until a coworker of mine recommended I try out their torta, I cannot wait to thank him on Monday for his suggestion! The breaded steak torta is sooooo delicious! I'm munching on it right now. No lie, they are huge so come with an appetite. I am only finishing a half because my stomach does NOT have room for any more. The lady making the sandwiches is extra sweet, and the gigantic sandwich is affordable!
author: Irene N.

description:
First of all, don't take the "Yelp" $2.00 off coupon to this place, just because it has Anthony Bourdain's name on it; , they don't honor it. 

I was looking for very cheer folks. like on the (Anthony Bourdain's-No Reservation) show.  But I guess it was all - for the show.

$10 for a combination sandwich was too much, I don't mind paiding that much for a sandwich, but it wasn't as good as I thought it was. 

I was very disappointed. Honestly, never again.
author: Naomi H.

description: Unsatisfied with our overpriced, bland, bougie tortas from the SF street food festival, we wandered further down Mission street in search of real tortas. The smell from the grill lured us into That's It and it was definitely the right spot. We ordered a chicken cubana torta. It was the size of my head. no BIGGER than my head. Seriously- she cut it in half and and just one half practically took up the whole plate! $6.50 for one torta and we both went home full... that's insane! The chicken was thin and had a breaded coating, which she fried right in front of us on a grill. The torta was slathered in sour cream/mayo with jalapenos for extra flavor. The other half of the little corner store is a liquor store so you can grab sodas or whatever to eat at the bar too. I think the owner is Greek or something but there was baklava and falafel balls behind the counter too... confusing but awesome! While she grilled up our order, I went in the back to use the bathroom and saw a little mouse. I was freaked out but after trying the sandwich, I'm glad I didn't miss out just because of a little rodent. Despite the fact that he was kinda cute, the mouse is the only reason this place didn't get 5 stars from me. Cheap prices, insane portions, jalapenos already piled high in my sandwich, and great flavor... but tiny little rodents running around in the back. Would I come back? Is That's It worth making our way through overpopulated San Francisco and the hike from bart? Two words: HELL YES.
author: Amanda M.

description:
GET THE CUBANA!!!

When  I go to the Mission District, I get the cubana instead of a burrito. The torta is super giagantic, super meaty, and super delicious. All for $10, or $8 with the coupon. I love going to That's It and watching one of the ladies make my sandwich. My boyfriend's eyes light up every time. They pack so much meaty goodness into the sandwich that I can only finish half. (The whole thing is bigger than my hand!)
author: Jessica M.

description:
my cubie went to this place to get the infamous cubano. no joke - this thing is ginormous! i could eat a lot (especially for my size), but hot damn this thing could feed 4 people. i didn't actually step into this place, but my cubie said the woman who made it was really nice. 

i have no idea what was in this sandwich, but it was pretty yummy. i probably cut out a year or two from my lifespan because i'm pretty sure this sandwich - even just half of it - is uber fatty. 

definitely worth sharing, decent price... but have a lot of napkins on hand because this monstrosity gets super messy.
author: Isabel D.

description: I am not a lover of meat so why would try this sandwich? Cause I'm a lover of Anthony Bourdain. He said it was off the hook. My bf wanted to try it and anytime anyone wants to take me to the mission I will follow. It is huge. It is full of every type of meat you could think of and a lot of other things. If you love love love meat you will love this. Me,well I ate my half of half and then my stomuch hurt. All the digesting I was forcing it to do.
author: Lauren N.

description:
I don't care if Anthony Bourdain loves their sandwiches. What the hell is up with the $20 minimum card fees? It's one of my biggest pet peeves. It's against Visa/MC/Amex/etc's terms of service to charge a minimum...and these guys want you to spend at least $20 before you can use your card without getting charged an extra 75 cents? I know it's not much, but it's the principle of the situation. 

Also, they like to sell you promo 2-for-1 packs of cigarettes as individual packs. Yes, the ones with the band around it that says "not for individual sale." One guy just tore the band off, effectively opening up my pack to get rid of that bit of info. What?!
author: Young T.

description: Imagine walking into a place that serves cigarettes, beer/liquor and your basic essentials that are provided in an unassuming liquor store. Add a kitchen and a friendly chef that emphasizes on home cooking and what do you have? A place that specializes in damn good tortas and high cholesterol.  I am not complaining in the least.  It's worth it.  And I wouldn't hesitate coming back here again and again.  I present to you That's It Market and their freakishly monstrous creation the 'Cubana Torta'.  The Cubana torta consists of eggs, bacon, chorizo, breaded beef, chicken, hot dog in between two toasty pieces of bread topped with guacamole and Mexican cheese.  The portion is huge so beware.  And while, I know that some people will place high expectations on the  place because it was featured in "No Reservations".  Remember that the appeal of this place is their peculiarity that happens to serves really good comfort food.  It's not fine dining.  It's just a place that serves good food to the average 'joe' at an affordable price.  I love this place.
author: James M.

description: Came here last night to reunite once again with the torta cubana. The first time I had it a few months ago it was so delicious it left me craving for it for months.  Of course I had to come back but now I was so disappointed I ended up throwing more than half of it in the trash. The difference? Lack of flavor and possibly love. Why? Different cooks. The first time I had it a very nice rounded lady with light skin prepared it.  She's the one you probably seen on Bourdains show.  Last night a thinner dark skin lady prepared it.
author: Tony Y.

description: My boyfriend and his bf (hah!) love this place, as the tortas are as big as your face. His face is rather large so you can pretty much guarantee a full meal. I, however, feel that the tortas lack taste. It's plain, it's big, it leaves no satisfying after thought. If you're looking for something big to stuff your face, it's a good option but if you're rather persnickety about where your calories are coming from, I'd pass.
author: Camille T.

description: basically if you want to turn into a huge fat ass, this is the sandwich to eat.  You literally might gain 2-3 lbs after eating this gem.  Which by the way is delicious and satisfying and definetly can be all eaten in one sitting if you not a huge wussy.  Anyway I liked the place, except that you cant drink alcohol there while eating the torta, which is crap.
author: christopher h.

description: For $8 with the Yelp discount, the cubana has everything you'd ever want on a sandwich.  Meat, meat, meat, meat, meat, meat, egg, avocado, lettuce, tomatoe, and jalepenos.  However, it's super damn big, so either split one, come with a large appetite, or buy it for multiple meals.
author: Andrew K.

description: Went in today with my sister, got a Milanesa de Res y Chorizo Torta for her, and I got a Jamon con Huevos Torta. I saw this place on No Reservations so I thought Id give it a try. These things are huge, We saw a group there split one in 3... I ate mine myself and now I feel like either dying, or sleeping. In fact I'm going to sum up this review because I'm tired.
author: Bruce W.

description:
so it had to be done. after reading about the torta cubana, i had to tackle it. 

i picked one up on my way home from work. the lady at the flattop was friendly, and started working right away. i watched it getting made, and started getting excited. 

biked it home and set up half of the sammie on a plate, and got to work. sausage, chorizo, hot dog, ham, cheese, cottage cheese, avocado, tomato, jalapenos, etc etc etc.

win. 

i ate half, which was a mistake cause that's a LOT of food. i wasn't hungry until lunch the next day, when i finished the rest.

there is absolutely no redeeming health value to this sandwich. it's delicious, almost to the point of being too much. 

but hey, it's not something you'll do every day, and i bet if i was drunk it would have been even better. it cost $10, but was a huge amount of food.

yes, it's commercialized from being on that show with that guy, but as i'm not a super cool hip kid, i don't care. it was worth it.
author: Brooke B.

description:
wow. just wow.

Folks were in town and my dad wanted to check this place out from no reservations. totally forgot to mention yelp and paid the 10 bucks for the cuban..

it fed 5 of us. that's right, 5 gringos stuffed from one torta. that's 2 bucks a pop.

others have mentioned the food porn in it's creation so i will save you. all i have to add is friendly service, friendly patrons and one of the best 2 dollar dinners ever.
author: Allegra F.

description:
thank you Bourdain! saw a rerun of the episode on monday, randomly had to go up north for a nite, forgot what street it was on, happened to book a motel 5 blocks past Geneva and spotted "That's It" on my way in. I ate on my way out, and went straight for the heart-stopping cubana. it was buttery, heavy, meaty, way salty, fatty and i loved greasy, last bite. all that was left was a piece of hot dog. it fell on the plate on my last bite, and i was in no condition to be reach down and relcaim it i can't help but think that my heart actually thanked me for the beating i gave it, if not only for this one time. and as far as the rating goes it came to my attention that they had exactly what you needed with a sandwich like that, but yet were not allowed to drink there, and thats a way cold beer.
and the correct ingredients (because i wrote them down in my ipod as it was being made) are:
beef
ham & bacon (yes both!!!)
hot dog 
chorizo con huevos
cottage cheese NOT head cheese (which is actually jellied pork or beef )
mayonaise
jalepenos (pickled and glorious)
avocado
tomato
lettuce 
sour cream
and the kitchen sink
author: Ryan L.

description: Going here was definitely an experience. One of the sides you see a Middle Eastern Owned typical Liquor store. Then on the other side is this latina who makes Tortas, Burritos, Gyros and all sorts of other dishes. Based on everyones comment on the "biggest" Torta Cubana sandwich I tried it. I thought it was good but I did not like that the sandwich had an oscar meyer wiener in there. Everything else about the sandwich was good. I definitely would prefer Tortas Los Picudos on 24th and Alabama (not too far away from this place) much more.
author: Nir B.

description: The Cubana Torta is outstanding.  Easily a meal for 2.  That part of the Mission can be a bit sketchy, so be alert when walking down there.  The food is definitely worth it though.
author: Tod S.

description: So I took my fatty parents to the Mission to prove to them that there are other areas to explore besides chinatown.  Along the way we ran into That's It Market.  My fat dad likes to watch No Reservations and of course he saw the recent SF episode.  So I told him the Cubana sandwich is made here.  The heart attack wrapped in paper was freakin hideous to look at but so good to eat.  I ate half of one and I had a myocardial infarction.  I don't know what that means.  It just sounds smart.  If they added a leg of lamb I would have given it 5 stars.
author: Fatty A.

description:
I've never been to Cuba, but I've eaten plenty of Cuban food in Florida and this place does not disappoint.  Expect to wait a few minutes for your food because they make everything fresh.  

We sat at the counter in this grocery store/deli and asked the Spanish speakers sitting next to us for suggestions.  They suggested the pumpkin flower quesadilla, fried.  We sat and watched and they downed 2 of these, but we opted for the grilled version of the same. Its a handmade corn tortilla with yummy fillings then topped with mexican sour cream, fresh cheese and lettuce.  

Delicious and authentic.

We actually went for the torta cubana but changed our minds when we saw these people eating the quesadilla   We saw a torta cubana cooking and it made us want to come back.

Go when you aren't in a rush.  Eat at the counter.  Speak Spanish.  Everything tastes better that way.
author: Brenda B.

description: One can witness all aspects of the neighborhood from this dusty den filled with cheap booze, porn & Mexican magazines. They also had food, which I was never drunk enough to try. There's a residential hotel (The Norma) right next door & witnessed more than one working girl buying pints of bottom shelf vodka here. There's also a large hipster contingency here, usually using the ATM, buying Sparks or getting cigarrettes. Perfect for picking up a Tall Boy to along with your Corneta or Farolito dinner or to pick up some Red Bull to mix with your vodka at Mission Bar, since they don't carry it.
author: Maria D.

description:
tried it

grossman, its like every type of meat all grossed up, like the thought of it makes me want to vomit

if you are a fat dood who like quality over quantity by all means, also you have to goto a really gross part of sf
author: Cristopher K.

description:
Yes, the Cubano is amazing.  It is BIG --  enough to feed two people for dinner at least.  Kind of makes me think it is the Mission's version of  Carnegie Deli sandwiches piled high.

Props to the store for having a gi-normous selection of beers.

Yes, the gal who makes them es una diosa.

Thanks YELP, for the $2 off coupon!!!!
author: Anne M.

description: A Mission liquor store with a marbled lunch counter serves a Cubana torta the size of a sofa pillow. It takes about 10 minutes to cook and assemble: chorizo and eggs, ham, chicken, hot dogs, avacado, tomato, queso... Despite the volume of cured meats, it maintains a savory balance--not too salty or greasy.  The secret ingredient is the bottle of homemade red, rosted chile salsa.  Yes, you want to pour salsa into the torta and lots of it.
author: E C.

description:
Delicious Tortas! Definitely 2 or 3 meals. So good.

Torta Cubana is just too much food. I haven't gone there yet.
author: Celeste C.

description: Went for the torta that Anthony Bourdain had on his show No Reservations. On the show, he drank a tall can and had his torta.... Unfortunately, they wouldnt let us. :( Still an amazing torta and we will definately go back again! Me and my boyfriend split one and there was still some left over!!
author: Sarah N.

description:
Couldnt finish the entire Torta.... Had to settle for Half!

pretty TASTY!
author: A. L. L.

description: huge delicious tortas! I can't handle the cuban torta with so much meat inside so I get the milanesa (thin steak very lightly breaded)... You can share the tortas but you might still be hungry so get your own and don't eat all the bread!
author: Ma B.

description: $10 for a torta and the hot dogs kind of ruined it.  Sandwich is decent.
author: Joseph C.

description: We came here for the sandwiches. It's one of those things that you eat once in your life and that is enough. We had the Cubano sandwich with everything. Everything means: battered beef, hot dog, chorizo, eggs, ham, avocado, mayo, lettuce, and tomato. That is a LOT of meat. Enough that I only managed to finish half the sandwich. Its $10 if you want to try.
author: Jun W.

description: Man, these guys just keep upping their prices.  The other day they tried to charge me $.59 for one of the 2 for $1.00 bags of peanuts.  The price is printed directly on the packaging as 2 for $1.00 It's the closest market to me, but now I wind up walking to the next one on Pine at Fillmore for 30% cheaper prices and later hours.
author: matthew w.

description: The Cubano is the only thing I've ever gotten my boss for lunch that he hasn't been able to finish, and not for lack of trying.  A solid contender for best sandwich in the city.
author: Jesse H.

description: An amazing dive.  The Cubana sandwhich was as big as my head!  So good.  So cheep.  Such a dump!
author: Jeffrey H.

description: My friend, who was visiting from out of town, saw this show on TV and recommended we go try the torta.  This baby was piled high with breaded pork, choritzo, ham, bacon, avacado, egg and cheese.  Great sandwich.  I think I could only handle about one of these per year though or else I would prolly have a heart attack.  The torta chef was very friendly also.  Def worth giving a try.
author: William T.

description: If you are not prone to cardiovascular diseases the Cubana is a must!
author: Jesper W.

description: The cubana is huge, but the quality is poor. It uses a lot of hot dog for filler. I guess the undeserved high reviews are due to all the inebriated and hungry club goers.
author: Lawrence L.

description: I'm not really reviewing so much as trying to clear up the "center of the mile" mystery on the "Thats It Market" sign.  Many, many years ago, in the 50's - 70's and even earlier, Mission Street was a great shopping street called "The Mission Miracle Mile".  There was a Woolworths  with a lunch-counter and a pet dept.,  there was a Newberrys  department store w/a lunch-counter, Kresses with a lunch-counter.  As you can see lunch-counters in a dept. store impresses me.  There was a HUGE Sears on Army and Mission St and many other shoe and clothing stores in-between.  i think the mile was from Army st to 16th st.  .There were even 2 Doggie Diners, one on Army & Mission and one on 18th & Mission st where you could get a Milkshake so thick you could hardly suck it through the straw.  So that's why "Thats It Market" is the Center of the Mile. BTW, I was born in the Mission in 1960 and have lived here all my life, so if you have any ?'s about the Mission, I'll try to answer them for ya.
author: Victor S.

description: maybe it's because we didn't order the torta cubana, but we couldn't stomach all that meat -- no matter how good anthony bourdain says it is.  we chose the chicken milanese instead.  imho, just because something is huge in portions doesn't equate to top marks.  this huge torta was slathered with an awful amount of mayonnaise, which made it unappealing.  we ended up picking out the chicken and eating it as is.
author: Sheri N.

description: i got the torta with chicken and my friend got a sandwich with turkey both were sooo delicious!!
author: Jessica B.

description: I had to try the "world's largest Torta" after seeing the Anthony Bourdain  San Francisco episode.  Now I can say, "been there done that".   I doubt  I'll repeat, especially at $10 bucks a Torta sandwich.  It's tasty and Huge, there are better food deals to be had in SF.   The lady cooking the sandwich is very nice, hard working  and courteous.
author: Alex W.

description: ALL wrong!!! that witch *ucked up my sandwich. half the *hit was missing ie: bacon, chicked and pork leg. she knowingly served us a sandwich that was false advertisted and hella overpriced. *uck that.... hella fake poser.... no wonder people from the mission don't eat there..... by the way from what i heard the new special is "cucaracha torta"
author: Joshua E.

description: i've only stumbled in here twice and was very pleased to discover that this little random corner store in the mission sells nat sherman cigarettes! not that i'm a smoker though. really.
author: J K.
